commit_message:
Use legacy infra puppet jobs from system-config

We moved these jobs into system-config so that we can more easily
mess with them. Run them from there on all the puppet repos.

Removes a template from infracloud repo - we need to retire it
anyway, so no need creating a new template.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720887
Change-Id: I4898e66037fdf7833b7ac8e6f4bd740032d71609

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Remove hacking from doc/requirements, we don't need to autodoc it.
- Remove Babel, this repo does not use it.

Change-Id: I8ad7b5e6ef11ea51c587ff58bfc54aee4fcda9da

commit_message:
Add new default roles in remaining servers policies

This adds new defaults roles in remaining servers
as PROJECT_ADMIN with TODO to move the to SYSTEM_ADMIN.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I72b48eb78fde29083bc23ddb25459f6c41590c37

commit_message:
Add focal-ussuri and bionic-ussuri bundle

This patch adds a focal-ussuri and bionic-ussuri bundles to the tests
for the charm.  Note that this requires a modified zaza (to use the
force_deploy option).

Note that the func-test change below is to fix the zaza test that
assumes that all subordinates are hacluster; in focal, there is also a
mysql-router subordinate.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/241
Change-Id: I17b9617917a4e0e14817c97023a4676db57937c0

commit_message:
Do not install mock from epel repo

mock package from epel is added in RDO CentOS8 ussuri build-deps
repo with [1], so let's use that instead of epel to avoid
epel related issues.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/q/topic:rdo-centos8-remove-epel

Partial-Bug: #1869842
Change-Id: Ifcb1c5e64ed0005f760aef8435a980d5bdefb193

commit_message:
Add new default roles in servers attributes policies

This adds new defaults roles in servers extended attributes
and host_status policies as SYSTEM_ADMIN but passing
project_id of server as these policies are scoped with
system and project.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I55a47d447f5f5b2d18754027f69e05e729d40338

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in remaining servers Policies

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for remaining server policies
as 'system' and project.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I7801685b8ded35c4aece27e2193674b70bd0633a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 00:14:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing remaining servers policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing remaining server
policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ibfc1917d35ab9e7657b13ec32582891f06d88176

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing remaining servers policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing remaining server
policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

host_status policies as 'system'.

pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in servers attributes Policies

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server extended attr and
host_status policies as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I06cd5bd497ef287ccc279672a71e36b2d4bc2adc

commit_message:
Convert flatten_nested_dict filter into a module

Fixed failure to run on Zuul controller due its security protections.
Modules are not affected by the same limitations as plugins or filters.

This also adds 3 module unittests.

Change-Id: Ida2f71a5077e56bf245060268d725eecac0a3e5b
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1627

subject: Move the haproxy iptables rules creation to host_prep_tasks
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-04-10 12:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-04-16 07:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-04-20 07:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-10 12:37:33.000000000', 'message': "Move the haproxy iptables rules creation to host_prep_tasks

The reason for this is that under deploy_tasks they won't be run during
an update (until the converge command is run). This is problematic
because in a composable HA being updated the haproxy firewall rules
might disappear due to other tasks cleaning the rules up and they won't
be recreated until converge. The problem is that that the temporary
containers will run during the minor update and try to access the db
which is now effectively firewalled off.

Historically this was at step 2, because haproxy was configured during
that step. Nothing should prevent us from creating the rules before and
that is what we do for the non-haproxy rules too anyway.

While moving it we need to take out the code from
::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy and use it directly because we do not
have the required 'step' variable set in host_prep_tasks and silly
puppet has now way of passing a hiera value on the command line (or via
other simple means)

Tested as follows:
1) Deployed a fresh Train environment with this patch and correctly
observed the haproxy fw rules:
[root@controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL INPUT |grep _haproxy |wc -l
27

2) Ran a minor update of controller-2, controller-1 and controller-0
(in that order) and verified that afterwards all _haproxy rules
are in place *before* the converge.

3) Confirmed that in the minor update logs we do see the step where
haproxy rules are enforced (previously this was not the case):
$ grep 'Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules' update-controller-2.log
TASK [Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules] **************************

4) Run a full minor update + converge of a composable HA environment

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to context

Closes-Bug: #1871646

Change-Id: Icba8a8292d1e2675c7da3513d00a4a0f4191747e
(cherry picked from commit 6220fe1bd319b8fabcc46b4b3fc705ac2f5526ed)
(cherry picked from commit 6c04309a35c4b9e30696795e25c7fe80076b733a)
"}, {'created': '2020-04-16 07:06:26.000000000', 'message': "Move the haproxy iptables rules creation to host_prep_tasks

27

$ grep 'Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules' update-controller-2.log
TASK [Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules] **************************

4) Run a full minor update + converge of a composable HA environment

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to context

Closes-Bug: #1871646

Change-Id: Icba8a8292d1e2675c7da3513d00a4a0f4191747e
(cherry picked from commit 6220fe1bd319b8fabcc46b4b3fc705ac2f5526ed)
(cherry picked from commit 6c04309a35c4b9e30696795e25c7fe80076b733a)

commit_message:
Move the haproxy iptables rules creation to host_prep_tasks

The reason for this is that under deploy_tasks they won't be run during
an update (until the converge command is run). This is problematic
because in a composable HA being updated the haproxy firewall rules
might disappear due to other tasks cleaning the rules up and they won't
be recreated until converge. The problem is that that the temporary
containers will run during the minor update and try to access the db
which is now effectively firewalled off.

Historically this was at step 2, because haproxy was configured during
that step. Nothing should prevent us from creating the rules before and
that is what we do for the non-haproxy rules too anyway.

While moving it we need to take out the code from
::tripleo::profile::base::haproxy and use it directly because we do not
have the required 'step' variable set in host_prep_tasks and silly
puppet has now way of passing a hiera value on the command line (or via
other simple means)

Tested as follows:
1) Deployed a fresh Train environment with this patch and correctly
observed the haproxy fw rules:
[root@controller-0 ~]# iptables -nvL INPUT |grep _haproxy |wc -l
27

2) Ran a minor update of controller-2, controller-1 and controller-0
(in that order) and verified that afterwards all _haproxy rules
are in place *before* the converge.

3) Confirmed that in the minor update logs we do see the step where
haproxy rules are enforced (previously this was not the case):
$ grep 'Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules' update-controller-2.log
TASK [Run puppet on the host to apply IPtables rules] **************************

4) Run a full minor update + converge of a composable HA environment

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to context

Closes-Bug: #1871646

Change-Id: Icba8a8292d1e2675c7da3513d00a4a0f4191747e
(cherry picked from commit 6220fe1bd319b8fabcc46b4b3fc705ac2f5526ed)
(cherry picked from commit 6c04309a35c4b9e30696795e25c7fe80076b733a)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I2b8d8d6cf4ac29dc58cd8fe418d613445d65c3be
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Create Symlink /usr/bin/ansible-playbook-3 when not exist

ansible-playbook-3 binary is no longer shipped with
ansible 2.9 package[1], so let's create it if it doesn't
exist. Once all usages of ansible-playbook-3 are removed
these all compatibility tasks can be cleaned up.

Also remove symlink creation of /usr/local/bin/ansible-playbook*,
as those were created temporary for fedora support[2].

[1] https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/ansible/blob/master/f/ansible.spec
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/632768/

Partial-Bug: #1873443
Change-Id: I40c860f22993efbe375c741c63513d764ba4eebc

commit_message:
Improve port retrieval when validating auto address

Improve port retrieval in method
"_validate_auto_address_subnet_delete". Instead of requesting each
port individually, a single DB query is executed to retrieve all
the ports with IP allocation in a in a subnet.

Change-Id: I7875142ebecd17663e17847fb14997200d7ae5c8
Related-Bug: #1865138

subject: Support for mariadb's ed25519 authentication
messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-04-18 09:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-04-20 07:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-18 09:36:10.000000000', 'message': "Support for mariadb's ed25519 authentication

Add Heat parameter EnableMysqlAuthEd25519, which when set to
true, drives puppet-tripleo in configuring MySQL user credentials
to require ed25519-based authentication (auth_ed25519) instead
of the default SHA1-based authentication (mysql_native_password).

This works starting with libsodium >= 1.0.18,
python3-pynacl >= 1.3.0-6.el8.rdo.1,
python3-PyMySQL >= 0.9.3-2.el8.rdo.1

Change-Id: I4f3d38ea70d48589be3e1b7f5eea96c358b44560
Partial-Bug: #1866093
(cherry picked from commit ccacc6ce3cc45dec6bcb4a637ff0a5684b6e697f)
"}]
commit_message:
Support for mariadb's ed25519 authentication

Add Heat parameter EnableMysqlAuthEd25519, which when set to
true, drives puppet-tripleo in configuring MySQL user credentials
to require ed25519-based authentication (auth_ed25519) instead
of the default SHA1-based authentication (mysql_native_password).

This works starting with libsodium >= 1.0.18,
python3-pynacl >= 1.3.0-6.el8.rdo.1,
python3-PyMySQL >= 0.9.3-2.el8.rdo.1

Change-Id: I4f3d38ea70d48589be3e1b7f5eea96c358b44560
Partial-Bug: #1866093
(cherry picked from commit ccacc6ce3cc45dec6bcb4a637ff0a5684b6e697f)

Ifb3afb13aff7e103c2e80ade817d0e63b624604a might be another way to do this btw.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-03-11 20:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Ifb3afb13aff7e103c2e80ade817d0e63b624604a might be another way to
 > do this btw.

This change ^ is specifically only for retrying http connection failures "Bad status line". If a connection attempt gets something like "Bad status line" it will retry. It won't help if you've established a connection already and then something failed.

We already have a similar option for the cinder client which defaults to 3:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#cinder.http_retries

So we already have http connection fail retries in place.

The only other way I'm aware of to do what you're doing in this patch is if you were to retry cinder client operations across the board by setting its retries keyword arg:

https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/d8b25483afa63333db389f0809f581dd1099fb65/cinderclient/client.py#L674

which will retry when various (all?) non-2xx status codes are returned from cinder API. You may not want that though if this is something you're only targeting for volume detach. Because if you set retries=N when creating the cinder client, that will be used for all of our cinder calls AFAIK.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-12 17:50:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

Looks pretty good to me again now. Once question inline and then I'm happy"}, {'account_id': 30009, 'date': '2020-03-13 14:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-02 15:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

commit_message:
Add retry to cinder API calls related to volume detach

When shutting down an instance for which volume needs to be
deleted, if cinder RPC timeout expires before cinder volume
driver terminates connection, then an unknown cinder exception
is received and the volume is not removed.

This fix adds a retry mechanism directly in cinder API calls
attachment_delete, terminate_connection, and detach.

Change-Id: I3c9ae47d0ceb64fa3082a01cb7df27faa4f5a00d
Closes-Bug: #1834659

commit_message:
Catch json.loads exceptions in verify_device_metadata

In case "TaggedBootDevicesTest.verify_device_metadata" "json.loads"
method returns an exception, catch it and return "False". This could
happen if, for example, the string to load is empty.

Because this function is called in an active wait loop, the content
string will be retrieved again and the check retried.

Change-Id: Id3a5b32f8ab197bcb1c59b5f6364dde4d8648eab
Closes-Bug: #1867904

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 09:47:01.000000000', 'message': "Skip 'test_image_member_lifecycle_for_multiple_stores' on failure

While running above test using python 3.7 environment, sometimes it closes
the client connection before getting the response causing 'ConnectionError'
and results in failure of the test. The reason for abrupt connection close
is 'test_image_member_lifecycle_for_multiple_stores' test makes lots of
connection requests which might causes race condition or dropping of
connection.

As a temporary solution caught the 'requests.exceptions.ConnectionError' and
skipped the test to avoid failure.

Change-Id: Ica04d8878eeb748cc4bbfedae895a54896ce16b3
Related-Bug: #1873735
"}]
commit_message:
Skip 'test_image_member_lifecycle_for_multiple_stores' on failure

While running above test using python 3.7 environment, sometimes it closes
the client connection before getting the response causing 'ConnectionError'
and results in failure of the test. The reason for abrupt connection close
is 'test_image_member_lifecycle_for_multiple_stores' test makes lots of
connection requests which might causes race condition or dropping of
connection.

As a temporary solution caught the 'requests.exceptions.ConnectionError' and
skipped the test to avoid failure.

Change-Id: Ica04d8878eeb748cc4bbfedae895a54896ce16b3
Related-Bug: #1873735

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 15:34:31.000000000', 'message': 'sphinxext: Make git query option

Change I49b659948f35381a44e2fb5f91dd6bf9e8ef619e provided a mechanism to
include the release note cache into generated sdists. Unfortunately,
attempting to build documentation with these tarballs generates the
following error:

  Exception occurred:
  File ".../lib/python3.7/site-packages/dulwich/repo.py", line 1004, in discover
    "No git repository was found at %(path)s" % dict(path=start)
  dulwich.errors.NotGitRepository: No git repository was found at PATH

This is because we're attempting to find the root of the git repo using
dulwich, which clearly isn't possible outside of a git repo.

Work around this by falling back to a search. We consider three options:
'.', '..', and '../..', which will handle calling Sphinx from the
rootdir, a 'docs' dir, and a 'docs/source' dir, which seem to be the
most common configurations.

We have no test coverage of the Sphinx integration so this is tested
manually.

Change-Id: Ic3a8ab8b127fd5bf51b91ac6e83d459ffc087fc4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Story: #1520096
Task: #6724
'}, {'created': '2020-04-20 16:39:57.000000000', 'message': 'sphinxext: Support rootdir discovery without git

We have no test coverage of the Sphinx integration so this is tested

Change-Id: Ic3a8ab8b127fd5bf51b91ac6e83d459ffc087fc4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Story: #1520096

commit_message:
sphinxext: Support rootdir discovery without git

Change I49b659948f35381a44e2fb5f91dd6bf9e8ef619e provided a mechanism to
include the release note cache into generated sdists. Unfortunately,
attempting to build documentation with these tarballs generates the
following error:

  Exception occurred:
  File ".../lib/python3.7/site-packages/dulwich/repo.py", line 1004, in discover
    "No git repository was found at %(path)s" % dict(path=start)
  dulwich.errors.NotGitRepository: No git repository was found at PATH

This is because we're attempting to find the root of the git repo using
dulwich, which clearly isn't possible outside of a git repo.

Work around this by falling back to a search. We consider three options:
'.', '..', and '../..', which will handle calling Sphinx from the
rootdir, a 'docs' dir, and a 'docs/source' dir, which seem to be the
most common configurations.

We have no test coverage of the Sphinx integration so this is tested
manually.

Change-Id: Ic3a8ab8b127fd5bf51b91ac6e83d459ffc087fc4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Story: #1520096
Task: #6724

commit_message:
Remove openstack overcloud failures command

This was added to fetch the ansible errors via mistral api. We had
long removed the json_error.py callback plugin that used to write
ansible-errors.json, when moving ansible code to tripleo-ansible
repo and the command is useless now. Also, users won't need it as
they can get the errors from ansible.log.

Change-Id: Iceb4c282f3ae9fcb2c3836263ba66f5792e42334

During update_available_resource periodic task, nova-compute reports total
amount of disk_over_committed in order to determine current hypervisor's
available_disk_least.

Currently, disk_over_committed is set to 0 for raw instances, which is
appropriate when [compute]/preallocate_images option is set to space as images
are fully allocated and because file size is equal to allocated size.
If not set, the raw disk file is sparsely allocated and
over_committed_disk_size have to be calculated in order to not mislead
available_disk_least value.

This change introduces over_committed_disk_size calucation also for raw disk.

Closes-Bug: #1870357

commit_message:
libvirt: Calculate disk_over_committed for raw instances

During update_available_resource periodic task, nova-compute reports total
amount of disk_over_committed in order to determine current hypervisor's
available_disk_least.

Currently, disk_over_committed is set to 0 for raw instances, which is
appropriate when [compute]/preallocate_images option is set to space as images
are fully allocated and because file size is equal to allocated size.
If not set, the raw disk file is sparsely allocated and
over_committed_disk_size have to be calculated in order to not mislead
available_disk_least value.

This change introduces over_committed_disk_size calucation also for raw disk.

Closes-Bug: #1870357

Change-Id: I9788ab12f5cfe0b1884f265482ceb9f533e9574e
(cherry picked from commit addd6caddaf2b0b808a414828d98486a9f7ffedd)

Wait, if tempest plugins are branchless, how do we test Train, where our tests run py27?

Also I think Genadi's team is still running this on Python 2."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-18 18:31:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Wait, if tempest plugins are branchless, how do we test Train,
 > where our tests run py27?
 > 
 > Also I think Genadi's team is still running this on Python 2.

Tempest and plugins run on venv of py3 on stable branch and that is why we use master version of tempest and plugins to test the stable branch. For py2 jobs on old stable branch or in rocky, stein or train, we need to use the Tempest and plugins old version. 

All py2 jobs and stable branch has been fixed in same way. neutron-tempest-plugin is one example. 

If any one outside gate want to run the Tempest or its plugin on py2 cloud, it can be done via 1. old version supporting py2.7 2. if they want tot use master then, install tempest and plugins in venv of py3.

Master Tempest and plugins cannot support py2 due to dependency and all. We have to move to py3-only in ussuir as per goal  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2020-04-20 15:20:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Tests seem to be running just fine in [1], so I'm merging this.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721249"}]

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

kuryr-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I275bb0bae3e59b0abbea807f401361b201962e7f

commit_message:
Fix noVNC failed TCs

- Fix noVNC failed TCs tempest.api.compute.servers.test_novnc.NoVNCConsoleTestJSON.test_novnc:
  * Current noVNC request miss the / prefix in GET header in the websocket upgrade request.
  * Current GET header GET ?token=xxx HTTP/1 can cause "HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request" error.
  * Fix the issue by adding / prefix and
  # updated request format is: GET /?token=xxx HTTP/1.1 or GET /websockify HTTP/1.1

Change-Id: I38a91b8e293e39625d08073e2b898451b6126ecb

commit_message:
Pass wait timeout all the way through to clients

Wait timeout is the non-interactive idle timeout setting. The default of
3600 is aligned to OpenStack's idle_timeout configuration default.

Proxy this value from the server to the client.

Depends-On: Ie2b2ad2856cbe1d830f1b7e674a2fb867d81de12
Change-Id: I0a40a65cdf1b618ec843bf872fe0b39866496e1c
Closes-Bug: #1841063

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-17 11:06:27.000000000', 'message': 'Filter by owner SGs when retrieving the SG rules

Retrieving the SG rules now is used the admin context. This allows to
get all possible rules, independently of the user calling. The filters
passed and the RBAC policies filter those results, returning only:
- The SG rules belonging to the user.
- The SG rules belonging to a SG owned by the user.

However, if the SG list is too long, the query can take a lot of time.
Instead of this, the filtering is done in the DB query. If no filters
are passed to "get_security_group_rules" and the context is not the
admin context, only the rules specified in the first paragraph will
be retrieved.

Because overwriting the method "get_objects" is too complex, an
intermediate query is done to retrieve the SG rule IDs. Those IDs
will be used as a filter in the "get_objects" call.

Conflicts:
      neutron/objects/securitygroup.py
      neutron/tests/unit/db/test_securitygroups_db.py
      neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #1863201

Change-Id: I25d3da929f8d0b6ee15d7b90ec59b9d58a4ae6a5
(cherry picked from commit d874c46bff7045ba25f5dd6e790f7ddb209cb224)
(cherry picked from commit d3905264b7659b1d10a68e3629861d5f0ba13568)
(cherry picked from commit 61dc621c1ba40efcedabdfb9f3a1854cea227d2c)
'}]
commit_message:
Filter by owner SGs when retrieving the SG rules

Retrieving the SG rules now is used the admin context. This allows to
get all possible rules, independently of the user calling. The filters
passed and the RBAC policies filter those results, returning only:
- The SG rules belonging to the user.
- The SG rules belonging to a SG owned by the user.

However, if the SG list is too long, the query can take a lot of time.
Instead of this, the filtering is done in the DB query. If no filters
are passed to "get_security_group_rules" and the context is not the
admin context, only the rules specified in the first paragraph will
be retrieved.

Because overwriting the method "get_objects" is too complex, an
intermediate query is done to retrieve the SG rule IDs. Those IDs
will be used as a filter in the "get_objects" call.

Conflicts:
      neutron/objects/securitygroup.py
      neutron/tests/unit/db/test_securitygroups_db.py
      neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_securitygroup.py

Closes-Bug: #1863201

Change-Id: I25d3da929f8d0b6ee15d7b90ec59b9d58a4ae6a5
(cherry picked from commit d874c46bff7045ba25f5dd6e790f7ddb209cb224)
(cherry picked from commit d3905264b7659b1d10a68e3629861d5f0ba13568)
(cherry picked from commit 61dc621c1ba40efcedabdfb9f3a1854cea227d2c)

commit_message:
Refactor OVN client QoS extension

The QoS OVN client extension is moved to the ML2 driver. This
extension is called from the OVN driver in the events of:
- create port
- update port
- delete port
- update network

The QoS OVN client extension now can accept several rules per policy
as documented in the SUPPORTED_RULES. The QoS OVN client extension
can write one OVN QoS rule per flow direction and each OVN QoS rule
register can hold both a bandwidth limit rule and a DSCP marking rule.

The "update_policy" method is called from the OVN QoS driver, when
a QoS policy or its rules are updated.

The QoS OVN client extension updates the QoS OVN registers
exclusively, based on the related events.

Closes-Bug: #1863852

Change-Id: I4833ed0c9a2741bdd007d4ebb3e8c1cb4c30d4c7

commit_message:
Remove support for CentOS 7

CentOS 8 support is now fairly complete - time to drop CentOS 7.

Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

Change-Id: I940b1d3eceb98e16fa366c243672f588b1412d70

commit_message:
Generalize ISO building for virtual media driver

Restructures code for virtual media deployment which creates
deploy/rescue/boot iso out of common kernel/ramdisk pair.
Currently hardware type ilo and redfish use this code.

Change-Id: Ifb66524c762ebe30e5c61b0c77ced65a817bbf19
Story: #2006437
Task: #36352

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I07b8931daabfedd0e570249a3744b591f665531a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix dashboard certificates skipping pkcs12 bundles

Octavia dashboard was skipping pkcs12 bundles when presenting
certificate options for TERMINATED_TLS listeners.
This patch corrects that so that users can select pkcs12 bundles
for use on their listeners.

Change-Id: I83687ed1476a9e413ca6a8a880dd31783450df67
Story: 2005436
Task: 30476
(cherry picked from commit acbaafbbce7c1f6e0323fd51c1476ab944d308cd)

commit_message:
Fix dashboard certificates skipping pkcs12 bundles

Octavia dashboard was skipping pkcs12 bundles when presenting
certificate options for TERMINATED_TLS listeners.
This patch corrects that so that users can select pkcs12 bundles
for use on their listeners.

Change-Id: I83687ed1476a9e413ca6a8a880dd31783450df67
Story: 2005436
Task: 30476
(cherry picked from commit acbaafbbce7c1f6e0323fd51c1476ab944d308cd)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build. Remove extra build step
  from docs build - api-ref is build separate.
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I7bb95a8ebd7023046baae30595159254bac25690

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 10:23:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix kibana deployment with openstack_cacert unset

When deploying Kibana with the default configuration of openstack_cacert
being unset, it fails due to an invalid configuration. The error message
is both unfriendly and useful:

"message":"child \"elasticsearch\" fails because [child \"ssl\" fails
because [child \"certificateAuthorities\" fails because [single value of
\"certificateAuthorities\" fails because [\"certificateAuthorities\"
must be a string]]]]"}

This is because we set elasticsearch.ssl.certificateAuthorities even
when there is no CA cert configured.

This change fixes the issue by only setting
elasticsearch.ssl.certificateAuthorities when a CA cert is configured.

Change-Id: I5954751451b7c931e8a9d79c713a2798522d8b81
Closes-Bug: #1864180
'}, {'created': '2020-04-08 16:13:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix kibana deployment with openstack_cacert unset

'}]
commit_message:
Fix kibana deployment with openstack_cacert unset

When deploying Kibana with the default configuration of openstack_cacert
being unset, it fails due to an invalid configuration. The error message
is both unfriendly and useful:

"message":"child \"elasticsearch\" fails because [child \"ssl\" fails
because [child \"certificateAuthorities\" fails because [single value of
\"certificateAuthorities\" fails because [\"certificateAuthorities\"
must be a string]]]]"}

This is because we set elasticsearch.ssl.certificateAuthorities even
when there is no CA cert configured.

This change fixes the issue by only setting
elasticsearch.ssl.certificateAuthorities when a CA cert is configured.

Change-Id: I5954751451b7c931e8a9d79c713a2798522d8b81
Closes-Bug: #1864180

commit_message:
Document ceph dashboard Safe mode feature

The Ceph dashboard is deployed using read-only privileges
for admin user, so no ceph cluster changes can be made
(e.g., pool creation).
The purpose of this new paragraph is to document the Safe
mode feature and how to alter the behaviour of the admin
user, providing fully administrative privileges.

Change-Id: Id98f49fd314ae4521fb73c26fae5bfaeea1abc4d
Signed-off-by: Francesco Pantano <fpantano@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions for Python3
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Move python3 to testenv in tox.ini
- Switch to hacking 3, fix problems found.

Change-Id: I26fcab3b288b5ed64c74f7a6725b43036f195d44

commit_message:
Use tripleo-image-serve role name for train

For train jobs use role name as "tripleo-image-serve".
For releases later than Ussuri use "tripleo_image_serve" as
in Ussuri release role name is changed to tripleo_image_serve.

Change-Id: Id1e3d05606b1f15b600fd8a069434a6dca27762e

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build with warnings enabled, fix
  warnings found with autodoc
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version, switch to using apidoc
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Change some imports to use python3 changed names

Change-Id: Ibb2e614c7db8a01e41caed8314c1d46479c78295

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I9357128c04f2fe0284432c1f6a543d63309efda3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Adding Tim Burke candidacy for Swift
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 10278, 'name': 'Jimmy McArthur', 'email': 'jimmy@openstack.org', 'username': 'jimmymcarthur'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 16708, 'name': 'Kendall Nelson', 'display_name': 'Kendall (diablo_rojo)', 'email': 'kennelson11@gmail.com', 'username': 'kjnelson'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-03-31 18:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-03-31 19:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-03-31 20:14:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Well this is annoying. Rotten time to try to change affiliations, I guess. I can log into openstackid.org and change emails, but then trying to log into openstack.org I either

* get a new member page that doesn't know about any history (but seems to have a profile ID of 120932) or
* can't log in, with

 Can't overwrite existing member #31487 with identical identifier (Email = tim@swiftstack.com))"}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:38:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Tim.  I should be able to help you. Would you prefer your Gmail be your primary address? Currently I'm showing it as secondary on your swiftstack account."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:39:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Those profiles also don't seem to be served from the member directory:

https://www.openstack.org/community/members/profile/31487
https://www.openstack.org/community/members/profile/120932

I've reached out to the www.openstack.org site admins to bring this problem to their attention."}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:41:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

That might be another issue. Tim is signed up as a Community member, not a Foundation member.  So Tim, you'll need to upgrade your account in order to have your member profile show up."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-01 15:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I noticed the community-member-ness, too. (TIL there's a https://openstackid-resources.openstack.org/api/public/v1/members?expand=groups&relations=affiliations,groups&filter[]=email==tim@swiftstack.com endpoint!) However, I currently can't log in to openstack.org to change it; I get the aforementioned "Can't overwrite ..." error.

My preference would actually be to have the NVIDIA email as primary now. That seems the most honest: I'm able to contribute code and time because of the support of (and at the request of) my employer, their priorities will surely affect my priorities, and it seems only fair that I should make that connection obvious.

So, at first I'd updated the openstackid.org profile to reflect that (leaving the SwiftStack email as tertiary). When logging in with that presented me with agreements I knew I'd already dealt with, I figured I must've accidentally created a new profile or something. So I tried backing out the change on openstackid.org, making SwiftStack primary again and dropping NVIDIA. But that didn't fix it either (see above).'}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2020-04-01 18:19:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Tim, can you tell me what your nvidia address is and i'll get your account straightened out?  Feel free to email me jimmy at openstack.org if you'd prefer."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-01 20:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

tburke@nvidia.com'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-04-01 21:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

I think at this point, since you missed having a valid patch before the deadline and the TC will be appointing the PTL (likely you since you are interested :)) I will -2 this since we don't accept candidacies after the deadline."}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2020-04-01 22:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Tim Burke - Your account should be all set now. I updated your original account to Foundation Member. Swapped the @swiftstack w/ @nvidia and removed the new duplicate account.

Please let me know if I can assist further.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-02 21:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-02 21:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks all! Just reproposing to confirm that things now behave the way they should.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-20 15:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717347/ merged; good enough'}]

subject: Stop configuring install_command in tox.
messages: [{'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-04-17 18:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-04-20 08:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-04-20 08:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-04-20 09:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-04-20 13:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-20 14:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-17 18:53:02.000000000', 'message': "Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Change-Id: Id0049dea1e16f9c459e7e63e5f7d96666fff708a
"}, {'created': '2020-04-20 08:03:02.000000000', 'message': "Stop configuring install_command in tox.

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Bumping the following libs in lower-constraints to avoid version
conflict:
-osprofiler 2.3.0
-python-keystoneclient to 3.22.0
-python-cinderclient to 5.0.0

Change-Id: Id0049dea1e16f9c459e7e63e5f7d96666fff708a

commit_message:
Update wording on tc roster

As the end date of a term is fluctuating, it's probably easier
to mention the elected date of each of the TC members, and users
can do the math.

This should clarify things.

Change-Id: I102296a986a1800c809ad875443f8a924dd0b30b

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Compression Change Bug Fix

This fix makes changes to compression change checks that
account for scenarios that do not have a service_level
key present in the extra_specs and gets the relevant
information from the pool_name instead.

Change-Id: I5deaf0b961378a3a18046bea97fc56e98c284f77
Closes-Bug: #1869731

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Switch to using sphinx-build, switch to use
  openstackdocstheme and update requirements

Change-Id: I67ba5ceb1728ee16b866ecf1b71cbf545a01b7d9

[{'created': '2020-04-17 11:40:31.000000000', 'message': "[Fullstack] Handle properly BrokenPipeError exception

NetcatTester class should handle BrokenPipeError exception
and not raise it to fail test immediately if nc process wasn't
yet started when it tries first time to read/write something to
it.

Closes-Bug: #1871908
(cherry picked from commit c92950b0eea55b8f16ae4ecea9366dba4419545a)
"}]

it.

commit_message:
Update HACKING document to match current checks

The HACKING document had gotten out of date with a few removals and
additions of hacking checks. This gets it synced up with the current
state of our checks.

Change-Id: I8ace7662bb11d5708dd507b79f4a2476c9875ac5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ibe31e2d17b8baf88c40e00e3beaa019b13594c7c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2017-09-14 00:28:55.000000000', 'message': "(WIP) Example python script to run Dockerfiles

With the theory that since our Dockerfiles are not actually Docker-
specific (we should work with other runtimes at some point) and
in fact we're already processing from something non-buildfiley
via our templating mechanism, we want to move to building containers
using something that is not Docker specific.

As a first stage, this converts a Dockerfile to a set of scripts
that can work with 'docker run' to build the container.  At some
future point, this allows us to change our file format from the
standard Dockerfile to something with more useful directives and
better substitution.

Change-Id: I75c088bf52fb1de7d9244aee6f8d86e64fa43aea

commit_message:
Run Dockerfiles using Python, not 'docker build'

With the theory that since our Dockerfiles are not actually Docker-
specific (we should work with other runtimes at some point) and
in fact we're already processing from something non-buildfiley
via our templating mechanism, we want to move to building containers
using something that is not Docker specific.

As a first stage, this converts a Dockerfile to a set of scripts
that can work with 'docker run' to build the container.  At some
future point, this allows us to change our file format from the
standard Dockerfile to something with more useful directives and
better substitution.

The new option --fastbuild enables this build.  The system defaults
to the current behaviour.

Change-Id: I75c088bf52fb1de7d9244aee6f8d86e64fa43aea

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme, reno, Sphinx, hacking versions
  for python3
- Add pytest as requirement, horizon does not provide this anymore and
  the tests here call horizon files that need it.

Change-Id: I5983a19cadb210d55c30107fb963cfeaae0f1ee9

subject: Moved openstack inventory script from community.general
messages:
[{'account_id': 22578, 'date': '2020-04-13 09:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-04-13 18:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

We should add a big flashing warning somewhere "please stop using this and use the inventory plugin instead"'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-14 09:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22578, 'date': '2020-04-16 10:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

This file is used as a configuration example for openstack_inventory.py. Users usually, keep these two files together (at least in ansible/ansible repo)'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-04-19 15:49:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

What is this script for? Isn't it covered by inventory module that we already have in ./plugins/inventory/openstack.py ? And where is it from? Looks like very old version of inventory module."}, {'account_id': 22578, 'date': '2020-04-20 04:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is an old inventory script that is referred in the Ansible documentation. The script is removed from ansible/ansible repo and we need this script in this repo for backward compatibility. We will add a warning to use a new inventory plugin instead of this script and in 4 release cycles remove it all together.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-04-20 08:32:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, I don't find it in ansible 2.9, when was it removed? In which version?"}, {'account_id': 22578, 'date': '2020-04-20 09:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It is here in 2.9 - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/stable-2.9/contrib/inventory/openstack_inventory.py

But in 2.10, it is not removed - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/contrib/inventory/openstack_inventory.py'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-04-20 09:10:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

seems like people still can use old script instead of inventory module, let's not deprive them of this joy"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-04-20 09:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

subject: backport dashboard certificates skipping pkcs12 bundles fix
messages:
[{'account_id': 31870, 'date': '2020-04-20 05:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-04-20 05:04:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-20 08:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Welcome to the OpenStack community and thanks for the backport, Tamerlan!

I believe you're backporting patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683751/. This patch has not been backported to the Train release yet. Ideally backports should be applied to newer stable releases first before older ones. Tn this case, Stein is older than Train and avoids regressions when someone upgrades from Stein to Train. Would it be possible to propose a backport to Train too?

Please note that it would be best if the backport patch could contain the same commit title and commit message as the original patch. Gerrit has a "Cherry Pick" button you can select and choose the branch you want the patch to be backported. Gerrit will take care of the commit title and message for you. In case of merge conflict or you prefer the CLI, you can do "git cherry-pick -x $COMMIT_SHA" followed by "git review" to submit to Gerrit.

Please let us know if you are not able to do this or have questions. We would be more than happy to help you!'}, {'account_id': 31870, 'date': '2020-04-20 10:42:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Carlos!

Thanks for explaining this to me. I've created cherry picks for both train and stein releases to keep things smooth. I'll close this particular change."}, {'account_id': 31870, 'date': '2020-04-20 10:50:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So it's either I'm blind or don't have a permission to close it. Could anyone kindly to this for me?"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-20 11:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks a lot, Tamerlan! Well done with the cherry-picks!
You should see an "Abandon" button next to the "Cherry pick" button.'}, {'account_id': 31870, 'date': '2020-04-20 11:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I7268264d3e2c98474604ec5f46298d36b7d32f18
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I4980bac7a558a291963270de592078f1a3af1111

Adam, feel free to comment if you have a different view. Otherwise, please do the honors of pushing the workflow button :)'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-10-17 16:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think the "opaque" type we are filtering on here is the only valid type in barbican for pkcs12 bundles. I think if you use certificate it fails validation as "certificate" is expecting x509 PEM.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-10-23 02:35:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I don't think that's true -- I don't think Barbican actually does any validation at all, it's just a user flag, as they support storing encrypted data too... I can double-check with Doug. commit_message:
Fix dashboard certificates skipping pkcs12 bundles

Octavia dashboard was skipping pkcs12 bundles when presenting
certificate options for TERMINATED_TLS listeners.
This patch corrects that so that users can select pkcs12 bundles
for use on their listeners.

Change-Id: I83687ed1476a9e413ca6a8a880dd31783450df67
Story: 2005436
Task: 30476

commit_message:
Migrate from ujson to simplejson

Additionally, temporarily set build-monasca-docker-image as non-voting
due to problems with buggy confluent-kafka 1.4.0 release, which prevents
building the Docker image.

Change-Id: I561ea633a09eb3d7468d2d55aa46d6fb3b2380ff
Story: 2007549
Task: 39390

Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I8ca155bda0939524a4b5d940ac719655fde9fc92
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update connection info in pre_live_migration

Connection info stays attaching after live
migration and other info such device path
is lost. To make info consistent, update
connection info when attachment complete
is done

Change-Id: Ifb4decb2cf6023dcf026998c7515f850a4aee201
Close-Bug: #1870866

commit_message:
Using unittest.mock instead of mock

We're only support py3 now, so using the standard library
unittest.mock instead of the mock module.

commit_message:
ensure centos-7 train image builds are tested

use a branched job to ensure build-image changes
do not impact older branches.  tripleo-ci is not
branched, so this coverage must be added.

Change-Id: I4684bce801b6af5fa416116424c339f73e6560d8

The backport looks good, conflict is noted and correct, plus this is a test only change. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-01-15 10:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1855927'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2020-04-20 09:05:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

OK it took me a bit of time to untangle the series between the two close related bugs : https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1856925 and https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1855927

What confused me is that this backport is a dependency for an old revision of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701757/2 which provides a fix for bug 1856925.

This dependency has been cut off in another revision of 701757 hence merged now, but we haven't released another revision of this change that'd have a potential backport of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699291/ which isn't yet merged upstream since we have problems with the gate.

+1 for asking whether we should clarify this one by just providing a separate Gerrit branch by only itself (and not having the already-merged https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701757/) so we could later work on the stable change https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699045/ with the same topic ?"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 15:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add recreate test for bug 1855927

When _poll_unconfirmed_resizes runs, if the actual resize
confirm fails on the source host the migration status may
be stuck in "confirming" status if it never reached the
source compute. Subsequent runs of _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will not be able to auto-confirm the resize nor will the user
be able to manually confirm the resize. An admin could reset
the status on the server to ACTIVE or ERROR but that means
the source compute never gets cleaned up since you can only
confirm or revert a resize on a server with VERIFY_RESIZE status.

This adds a functional recreate test for the bug.

Note that if the request does get to the source compute and fails,
the _error_out_instance_on_exception context manager should set
the instance to ERROR status and the errors_out_migration decorator
should set the migration status to "error". The problem is if we
never get that far we can't recover automatically or via the API
without operator intervention.

Change-Id: I93e27d907a237ae16b6b4c7202ad157b067aa30e
Related-Bug: #1855927
(cherry picked from commit 95c9d710dd6a06b8d2fcd941343075872cdf95d5)
'}, {'created': '2020-01-09 20:14:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add recreate test for bug 1855927

When _poll_unconfirmed_resizes runs, if the actual resize
confirm fails on the source host the migration status may
be stuck in "confirming" status if it never reached the
source compute. Subsequent runs of _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will not be able to auto-confirm the resize nor will the user
be able to manually confirm the resize. An admin could reset
the status on the server to ACTIVE or ERROR but that means
the source compute never gets cleaned up since you can only
confirm or revert a resize on a server with VERIFY_RESIZE status.

This adds a functional recreate test for the bug.

Note that if the request does get to the source compute and fails,
the _error_out_instance_on_exception context manager should set
the instance to ERROR status and the errors_out_migration decorator
should set the migration status to "error". The problem is if we
never get that far we can't recover automatically or via the API
without operator intervention.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts as I8c96b337f32148f8f5899c9b87af331b1fa41424
is not present on stable/train.

Change-Id: I93e27d907a237ae16b6b4c7202ad157b067aa30e
Related-Bug: #1855927
(cherry picked from commit 95c9d710dd6a06b8d2fcd941343075872cdf95d5)
'}]
commit_message:
Add recreate test for bug 1855927

When _poll_unconfirmed_resizes runs, if the actual resize
confirm fails on the source host the migration status may
be stuck in "confirming" status if it never reached the
source compute. Subsequent runs of _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will not be able to auto-confirm the resize nor will the user
be able to manually confirm the resize. An admin could reset
the status on the server to ACTIVE or ERROR but that means
the source compute never gets cleaned up since you can only
confirm or revert a resize on a server with VERIFY_RESIZE status.

This adds a functional recreate test for the bug.

Note that if the request does get to the source compute and fails,
the _error_out_instance_on_exception context manager should set
the instance to ERROR status and the errors_out_migration decorator
should set the migration status to "error". The problem is if we
never get that far we can't recover automatically or via the API
without operator intervention.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts as I8c96b337f32148f8f5899c9b87af331b1fa41424
is not present on stable/train.

Change-Id: I93e27d907a237ae16b6b4c7202ad157b067aa30e
Related-Bug: #1855927
(cherry picked from commit 95c9d710dd6a06b8d2fcd941343075872cdf95d5)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I8783d496616a77c3ec6d70c3295f3a17de0e7e80
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Mark MacroSAN Driver Supported

Add new optional features:
* Revert to snapshot
* MultiAttach
* Thin Provisioning
* Consistency Groups
* volume replication
* Qos
* Attach Snapshot
* Online Extend Support

The 3rd Party CI is running. Therefor, the driver is being marked
supported in 'U' release.

Change-Id: Ia26fa9763efd329d0be62e2c418322056f5b086d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 21:23:30.000000000', 'message': 'PoC: Docker multi-stage builds

Proof of concept: support multi-stage image builds for source images.

Multi-stage builds allow for smaller images, by installing build-time
dependencies in an intermediate image which is then discarded. The final
image contains only the product of the build process, which in the case
of kolla source images is typically the virtual environment.

The approach taken repurposes the openstack-base image as a base image
for intermediate stage builder images. It fits this purpose well since
it mostly adds python build dependencies and the kolla virtual
environment.

A new image, openstack-base-source (name could be better), is used as
the base image for final stage images, and contains the few packages
from openstack-base that are actually required at runtime.

The new hierarchy is as follows:

base -> openstack-base -> glance-base (stage 1)
base -> openstack-base-source -> glance-base (stage 2) -> glance-api

Currently this has only been implemented for Glance images.

The current approach results in a significant reduction in the image
size:

REPOSITORY                                TAG                   SIZE
kolla/centos-source-glance-api            single-stage-glance   917MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-registry       single-stage-glance   871MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-base           single-stage-glance   871MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-api              multi-stage-glance  763MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-base             multi-stage-glance  721MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-registry         multi-stage-glance  721MB

The savings come from not including the python build dependencies or
source code in the final image.

The design could probably be improved upon.

Change-Id: Id4955dc547748ec5bf620fd106115a63ab3a6495
'}, {'created': '2019-01-18 11:02:38.000000000', 'message': 'PoC: Docker multi-stage builds

commit_message:
PoC: Docker multi-stage builds

Proof of concept: support multi-stage image builds for source images.

Multi-stage builds allow for smaller images, by installing build-time
dependencies in an intermediate image which is then discarded. The final
image contains only the product of the build process, which in the case
of kolla source images is typically the virtual environment.

The approach taken repurposes the openstack-base image as a base image
for intermediate stage builder images. It fits this purpose well since
it mostly adds python build dependencies and the kolla virtual
environment.

A new image, openstack-base-source (name could be better), is used as
the base image for final stage images, and contains the few packages
from openstack-base that are actually required at runtime.

The new hierarchy is as follows:

base -> openstack-base -> glance-base (stage 1)
base -> openstack-base-source -> glance-base (stage 2) -> glance-api

Currently this has only been implemented for Glance images.

The current approach results in a significant reduction in the image
size:

REPOSITORY                                TAG                   SIZE
kolla/centos-source-glance-api            single-stage-glance   917MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-registry       single-stage-glance   871MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-base           single-stage-glance   871MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-api              multi-stage-glance  763MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-base             multi-stage-glance  721MB
kolla/centos-source-glance-registry         multi-stage-glance  721MB

The savings come from not including the python build dependencies or
source code in the final image.

The design could probably be improved upon.

Change-Id: Id4955dc547748ec5bf620fd106115a63ab3a6495

commit_message:
Get validation groups info from groups.yaml file

This patch makes the VALIDATION_GROUPS list constants dynamic by getting
them from the 'groups.yaml' file. This file comes from
tripleo-validations and is present on the Undercloud at the location [1].

[1] => /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-validations

Change-Id: Ide8cba32a0ea14086714094291f1a8866b669491
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit afb9887a408dc7ce4b178f730ea17f7c77f120b9)

subject: Stop configuring install_command in tox.
messages: [{'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-04-17 18:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-04-19 17:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-04-20 08:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-17 18:50:09.000000000', 'message': "Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Change-Id: Idda0a78f63d5bc3e8c9e56e042630c8d28db2162
"}]
commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Change-Id: Idda0a78f63d5bc3e8c9e56e042630c8d28db2162

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Change-Id: I22eb2dc7935b529301c3608ac81d6b60998014fb

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Change-Id: I2cdb74a8d3ce88c3b6d7b4f84b0aa0a990753ce5
"}]
commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Change-Id: I2cdb74a8d3ce88c3b6d7b4f84b0aa0a990753ce5

commit_message:
Remove pypy job from x/surveil

x/surveil has not merged a single change since 2015, remove pypy job so
that the template can eventually get removed.

Change-Id: Icb5026ba4dfe7867fffd6bd5b06eee71acf4bce4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-20 07:05:03.000000000', 'message': 'Move Ubuntu builds away from nb04

Something about the debootstrap processes destroys the nodepool
container, making not only this Ubuntu builds fail but then every
build after.

Move them back to regular builders while we debug further.

Change-Id: I48eb721bffafe2404a332192976848dba2ca80cc
'}]
commit_message:
Move Ubuntu builds away from nb04

Something about the debootstrap processes destroys the nodepool
container, making not only this Ubuntu builds fail but then every
build after.

Move them back to regular builders while we debug further.

Change-Id: I48eb721bffafe2404a332192976848dba2ca80cc

commit_message:
[k8s] Introduce helm_client_tag label.

Added label helm_client_tag to allow user to specify helm client
container version.

Task: 39294
Story: 2007514

Change-Id: I5d1cf238511951ac4a1849ca66b74dc747865391
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version, update other needed
  requirements
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Update tox.ini for python3 support

Change-Id: I0c9f7ae65a8e1c1d7fec77e3958c54324213158b

(4 comments)

basically, LGTM'}, {'account_id': 30001, 'date': '2019-07-05 19:39:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(3 comments)

I like how this is moving towards nested RP to describe/track fine grain components of the CPU.
I'm not sure I understood where will it be keeping the policies.
Will this solution be compatible with RMD managing dynamically the cache allocations out of band?. We may need to have a forbidden aggregate on a node where you want to do static fine grained cache and memory to avoid RMD doing changes independently."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-07-09 18:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

(4 comments)

the intent for RMD integration is to disable reportign cache and memory by using the config options allowing RMD to manage those resouce out of band. the user can still request them using the extra specs but it would be up to rmd to create the inventories in placmenet and enforce the allocation out of band on of the libvirt dirver.

setting work flow -1 while i think about the feedback and dependencies.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-07-10 16:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Given the curn in both the placement api feature and nova use of them im going to abandon this for the Train cycle so that we can focus on testing and using the basics use cases for resourceless RP and same sub tree groupings.

lets come back to cache support in U after some of the other features crystallise and this will be less distributive.

im partacalary concerned by the added complexity a placmeent native version of this will impose on modeling PCUs in placement or numa topologys in placement for upgrades.

it will also intodcue significant complexity in the cpu pinning logic as if cpus are not all groups on the root RP all that code needs to be made RP aware so that it only assign cores form the physical resources that correlate to the RP selected in the placement allocation.

this complexity is unavoidable and is not a reason to avoid this in the future but the code curn we are adding in  the hardware.py module this cycle to support basic PCPU tracking in placement i what makes cache affined cpu pinning untenable to cram into train this close to m2

hopefully in U we will finally be able to support this use case.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-10 19:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks Sean. Perhaps you want to propose this to the backlog/ directory?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-30 13:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The nova-specs repository has been populated for ussuri. You may restore and move this spec if needed.'}]

commit_message:
add libvirt pqos spec

This spec propoposes adding support for static allocation of cache
and memory bandwidth limits to the libvirt virt driver.

blueprint libvirt-pqos
Change-Id: If2a5ec0e1c08d3a5d86f5cf1ba597611b3139774

commit_message:
VNF LCM API ETSI NFV-SOL specification update

Following points are updated:-

1. Removed 'scaleStatus' as it is not supported.
2. Added DB columns 'instantiation_level_id', 'additional_params'
   and 'task_state'. Explained the need of introducing 'task_state'.

Implements: bp/support-etsi-nfv-specs
Change-Id: I20f04fb08602f8d743efd483c9079b19740759c4

commit_message:
Update docs building

Update docs building:
* Switch to sphinx-build
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3
* Remove unneeded doc and translation sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.

Change-Id: Ib9fe754b700bceb164ba0f596cbcc6d864ccbadc

subject: Add support to build netcontrold binary image
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'marcin.juszkiewicz+kolla@linaro.org', 'username': 'hrw'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'email': 'radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com', 'username': 'yoctozepto'}, {'_account_id': 31108, 'name': 'Gowrishankar', 'email': 'gmuthukr@redhat.com', 'username': 'gmuthukr'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-01-29 04:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-01-29 07:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31108, 'date': '2020-01-29 14:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Agreed to support binary build if package available.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-30 08:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

we support binary only from official repos'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-01-30 09:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> we support binary only from official repos

Thanks for your comments. As this tool is associated with OVS, we will work on it to align with official repo. Till it is ready, if we need to build the binary image, do you suggest any other alternative? Is it acceptable to build with pip for binary image too?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-30 09:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

well, locally you can do whichever works best'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-01-30 10:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-01-30 10:09:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-30 10:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

does not RDO want to build these packages?'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-01-30 10:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> does not RDO want to build these packages?

netcontrold is not specific to openstack. It can be used in other deployments with ovs-dpdk, like kubernetes with ovs-dpdk. Ideally, it is preferrable to place it as part of platform packages. There is no conclusion on it yet, still in the process of finding the right home for it. 

Meanwhile, we wanted to enable openstack ovs-dpdk deployments with netcontrold so that multi-queue can be enabled to enhance the packet throughput performance.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-04-20 04:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add support to build netcontrold binary image

netcontrold release supports rpm binary version.
Added support to build container with netcontrold rpm.

Change-Id: Idaaee886ceb6cf29494369e771f8ec453550e3f9

commit_message:
Enable tripleo-image-serve in CentOS8

docker-distribution not available for C8, so
let's use tripleo-image-serve for registry usage.

Also collect httpd config and repo files for
debugging.

Change-Id: I0264d1c3d56995ed5dec6342a5f235936e807fe3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-14 09:25:00.000000000', 'message': "Implement 'selector-append' sass function

'selector-append' is used in xstatic-mdi [1] but it isn't supported by
the latest pyScss.
As a workaround we use 'append-static' function from pyScss until
'selector-append' will be supported.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-mdi/src/tag/1.6.50.2/xstatic/pkg/mdi/data/scss/_functions.scss#L2

Change-Id: Ib8ca0fcfe339cb68d6a157a00cbc2d34854ef4c5
Closes-Bug: #1771559
"}, {'created': '2020-04-14 13:48:34.000000000', 'message': "Implement 'selector-append' sass function

the latest pyScss.

'selector-append' will be supported.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-mdi/src/tag/1.6.50.2/xstatic/pkg/mdi/data/scss/_functions.scss#L2

'selector-append' will be supported.

because we don't need it anymore.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-mdi/src/tag/1.6.50.2/xstatic/pkg/mdi/data/scss/_functions.scss#L2

Change-Id: Ib8ca0fcfe339cb68d6a157a00cbc2d34854ef4c5
