commit_message:
Add rootwrap filter rule for radvd-kill script

In patch [1] support for custom kill scripts was added.
We also added rootwrap filter rules for such scripts to
kill dnsmasq, haproxy, dibbler and keepalived processes.
But we missed to add rule for radvd-kill so this patch
adds it (better late than never ;))

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661760/

Closes-Bug: #1873240

Change-Id: I8fa7176d1d9667c6b5cc95af0e31210d0f1c3662

messages: [{'account_id': 25251, 'date': '2020-04-10 14:09:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-17 18:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-04-18 00:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-10 14:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up protobuf message definitions

Naming was inconsistent and some messages were reused, sometimes with
useless fields. Follow the grpc/protobuf best practice of naming input
and output protobuf message after the RPC function:
MyFunction() will take MyFunctionRequest() and return MyFunctionReply()

A couple of exceptions are made in cases where it does makes sense to
reuse a message (for listdir() like functions)

Change-Id: I5063cef634e2de80934c75aebed5707b1683d5d5
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up protobuf message definitions

Naming was inconsistent and some messages were reused, sometimes with
useless fields. Follow the grpc/protobuf best practice of naming input
and output protobuf message after the RPC function:
MyFunction() will take MyFunctionRequest() and return MyFunctionReply()

A couple of exceptions are made in cases where it does makes sense to
reuse a message (for listdir() like functions)

Change-Id: I5063cef634e2de80934c75aebed5707b1683d5d5

commit_message:
Adding description for testcases - volume part1

When Tempest is used in customer site, often we are required to
provide a testcase list including testcase names and descriptions.
Now no this kind of doc is available, so we can add descriptions
with the format of doc string for every testcase, so later we
can generata such a testcase description list.

There are hundreds of testcases missing descriptions, so we can
add them gradually, and limit the modified files in one patch
for the convenience of reviewing.

Change-Id: I9840ea976d290a8fd22d8c3bae17db9ed42f629a
partially-implements: blueprint testcase-description

commit_message:
Adding description for testcases - identity part1

When Tempest is used in customer site, often we are required to
provide a testcase list including testcase names and descriptions.
Now no this kind of doc is available, so we can add descriptions
with the format of doc string for every testcase, so later we
can generata such a testcase description list.

There are hundreds of testcases missing descriptions, so we can
add them gradually, and limit the modified files in one patch
for the convenience of reviewing.

BTW: some minor code refactor is done along with this patch.

commit_message:
Adding description for testcases - compute part2

When Tempest is used in customer site, often we are required to
provide a testcase list including testcase names and descriptions.
Now no this kind of doc is available, so we can add descriptions
with the format of doc string for every testcase, so later we
can generata such a testcase description list.

There are hundreds of testcases missing descriptions, so we can
add them gradually, and limit the modified files in one patch
for the convenience of reviewing.

Change-Id: I3d1634fab5826928a45bd47c18aba6fc32021075
partially-implements: blueprint testcase-description

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: Ib70fcdc751a1e84d3160558361a76bbd328f4625

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 20:25:30.000000000', 'message': 'Create generic share type

If no default share type is specified on the
config for tempest, running scenario tests fail.
In order to fix this, we simply create a share type
for usage within our tests and we stop depending
on the pre-config.

This patch set tries to get a default share type,
if not, simply creates one.

This also fix a related issue with the specs passed
for the share types. If mountable snapshots tests are
enabled then we create a share type with that
extra spec specified.

Change-Id: Ifaf00b7a5e895a5b79f268dbdcaa3ef20b21ea68
Closes-Bug: #1755795

commit_message:
Create a generic share type (scenario tests)

If no default share type is specified on the
config for tempest, running scenario tests fail.
In order to fix this, we simply create a share type
for usage within our tests and we stop depending
on the pre-config.

This patch set tries to get a default share type,
if not, simply creates one.

This also fix a related issue with the specs passed
for the share types. If mountable snapshots tests are
enabled then we create a share type with that
extra spec specified.

Change-Id: Ifaf00b7a5e895a5b79f268dbdcaa3ef20b21ea68
Closes-Bug: #1755795

commit_message:
Docs cleanup and hacking update

Switch to using sphinx-build, cleanup conf.py, update
to newer sphinx and openstackdocstheme versions for Python 3.

Update to hacking 3.0.

Fix build problems.

Change-Id: Ib3ea77c973a9592710a9d75c76c443881f1a4bc1

commit_message:
swift-external: deprecate External*Url

ExternalPublicUrl (and the 2 others) are too generic to know that they
are for Swift only.
Let's rename them and deprecate the old ones.

This patch does the following:
ExternalPublicUrl, ExternalAdminUrl and ExternalInternalUrl are deprecated.
ExternalSwiftPublicUrl, ExternalSwiftAdminUrl and ExternalSwiftInternalUrl
should now be used.

Change-Id: I4634447762aad20f2c450fe4bb7f0803d13efec2
(cherry picked from commit 415d4de0884a691a01f14e7954aadc203e033a8b)

Remove mock from requirements

We don't use this third party lib anymore,
since https://review.opendev.org/#/c/717325/

Change-Id: Ibe4423cf3893981128addbf4fa31ba9003a7e968
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

[{'account_id': 29965, 'date': '2019-02-22 01:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-22 01:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2019-02-22 02:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(7 comments)

Hi,
Thanks for the contribution!
Please run ``tox -epep8`` in local env and fix the issues before pushing patches to gate, i've mentioned some common ones inline.
Also related unit tests and release note is required."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-02-27 20:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority-1

Need to hold for Train.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-09 18:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to train-drivers'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-09 18:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Train is now open.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-05-02 21:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29965, 'date': '2019-05-04 03:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)

A verification code is required for the simulated login, and the next version will be read from our configuration file.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-07-03 16:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We will stop accepting drivers for Train the week of 7/22.  If you want to merge this you will need to address comments before then please.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-09 16:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from train-drivers to ussuri-drivers'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-19 15:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from ussuri-drivers to victoria-drivers'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-03 16:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Comments need to be addressed, needs to add driver documentation and a release note, and third party CI still needs to be running.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 14:32:55.000000000', 'message': "Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (2 of 2)

This is part 2 of 2, where ovn provider info located in
tripleo::profile::base::octavia::api will move
to newly created octavia::provider::ovn.
But that has to be split into 2 parts to avoid breaking the
CI until the THT+pupple-tripleo changes merges [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bug/1861886+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714895/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715950/

Related-Bug: #1861886

Change-Id: If4a6f25015374883050c48b7705e8207906118f4
(cherry picked from commit ccaf9c88513cd1046b9e16fdb3b2759c9b07c550)

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (2 of 2)

This is part 2 of 2, where ovn provider info located in
tripleo::profile::base::octavia::api will move
to newly created octavia::provider::ovn.
But that has to be split into 2 parts to avoid breaking the
CI until the THT+pupple-tripleo changes merges [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bug/1861886+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714895/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715950/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705821/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714916/

Closes-Bug: #1861886

Change-Id: If4a6f25015374883050c48b7705e8207906118f4
(cherry picked from commit a485965a2326cb1e62c2597b3eeac7e2cd54131f)

commit_message:
Support manage/unmanage in the FusionStorage Cinder Driver

In order to improve the functionality of the FusionStorage Cinder
Driver, the "manage_existing/unmanage" is added.

Change-Id: I7dd5fed5b954181d4986ca38942fdc60f190bda2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 10:37:58.000000000', 'message': 'rbd: Use showmapped to find the root RBD device during disconnect_volume

The original method of unmapping the higher level RBD device found under
/dev/rbd/{pool}/{volume} fails when an encryptor has been attached to
the volume locally. This is due to a symlink being created that points
to the the decrypted dm-crypt device, breaking any attempt to unmap the
RBD volume.

To avoid this we can simply find and unmap the lower level RBD device of
/dev/rbd*.

Change-Id: Id507109df80391699074773f4787f74507c4b882
(cherry picked from commit 9415b3b41f55b66bee589bc8ff5f1c789d8a5d0e)
'}]
commit_message:
rbd: Use showmapped to find the root RBD device during disconnect_volume

The original method of unmapping the higher level RBD device found under
/dev/rbd/{pool}/{volume} fails when an encryptor has been attached to
the volume locally. This is due to a symlink being created that points
to the the decrypted dm-crypt device, breaking any attempt to unmap the
RBD volume.

To avoid this we can simply find and unmap the lower level RBD device of
/dev/rbd*.

Change-Id: Id507109df80391699074773f4787f74507c4b882
(cherry picked from commit 9415b3b41f55b66bee589bc8ff5f1c789d8a5d0e)

1) microversion needs to be bumped throughout to match the manila side.

2) I did this, applied both manila and python-manilaclient patches to my devstack, shutdown all manila services, ran 'manila-manage db sync', and started all services.  When I run a modify against an existing access-rule:

$ manila  --debug access-list-modify 8ff0a08f-de60-495e-ba19-538fb73a04f1 --priority 1

I see that the request doesn't conform to the api expectations that its body contain a priority field:

commit_message:
Add priority for access rule

Add new priority attribute in allow/update/list
access rule commands.

Depend-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572283
Change-Id: Ibfbf122516e1c0a44f74f161060d849a879adaf9
Implements: bp add-priority-for-access-rule

So I don't think we have thought this through well enough to have it actually work end-to-end.  And by "we" I'm not just being polite, I really do mean all of us.

We agreed at PTG and at spec signoff time that the manager will hand off the rules to the back end driver in sorted order without a priority field so that the drivers can just assume a priority ordering from the order of the rules received.

Drivers still get add_rules, delete_rules, and the whole set of rules.

But we haven't modified the drivers the whole set of rules in every circumstance, including simple adds and deletes.

For example the Huawei driver [1] will in the case of an add or delete simply pass the added or deleted rules to the back end.  The back end will have no idea that it's supposed to insert new added rules before or after others -- the added rules will be in the right order, but there is no information about whether each of them is before or after others already in the back end.

As another example, consider the lvm driver [2], which has the same issue, and a nice comment explaining why.

Even drivers that apply the whole set of rules on every add and deny like NetApp [3] aren't ready because they themselves sort the entire set of rules before applying them and use different sort criteria.

I'm not saying that we can't make this work, but with the variety of back ends and given that we haven't started to patch them yet, I don't see how we could get this done in this cycle.


[1] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py#L810

[2] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/lvm.py#L317

[3] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/protocols/nfs_cmode.py#L75'}, {'account_id': 26968, 'date': '2018-07-26 07:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

So I don't think we have thought this through well enough to have it actually work end-to-end.  And by "we" I'm not just being polite, I really do mean all of us.

We agreed at PTG and at spec signoff time that the manager will hand off the rules to the back end driver in sorted order without a priority field so that the drivers can just assume a priority ordering from the order of the rules received.

Drivers still get add_rules, delete_rules, and the whole set of rules.

But we haven't modified the drivers the whole set of rules in every circumstance, including simple adds and deletes.

For example the Huawei driver [1] will in the case of an add or delete simply pass the added or deleted rules to the back end.  The back end will have no idea that it's supposed to insert new added rules before or after others -- the added rules will be in the right order, but there is no information about whether each of them is before or after others already in the back end.

As another example, consider the lvm driver [2], which has the same issue, and a nice comment explaining why.

Even drivers that apply the whole set of rules on every add and deny like NetApp [3] aren't ready because they themselves sort the entire set of rules before applying them and use different sort criteria.

I'm not saying that we can't make this work, but with the variety of back ends and given that we haven't started to patch them yet, I don't see how we could get this done in this cycle.


[1] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py#L810

[2] https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/manila/share/drivers/lvm.py#L317

Jun writes:

> We cloud continue to do it in next cycle and let other drivers help us to do more test for this feature.

I agree.  We should take this as a backlog topic to the Stein PTG.  We need a work plan for the drivers and a common understanding of how we are going to handle drivers that do not conform.  The spec says that "we will audit drivers that are re-ordering the rules and report bugs right away."  But we haven't done the audit.  Worse, the problem is deeper than just drivers that re-order - add_rules and deny_rules are no longer helpful so all drivers that did incremental additions and deletes have to change to clear-all-rules-and-refresh behavior on every update.'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2018-07-26 11:24:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

(3 comments)

In general, can you split this into multiple commits please? This huge changeset makes it more difficult for reviewers than needed.
In this case, you do multiple things:

1) you allow to update share access rules
2) you allow server side sorting of share access rules
3) you add the priority field to share access rules

Or is there any good reason why all this needs to be done in a single changeset?'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2018-12-13 17:38:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

commit_message:
Add priority for access rule

Currently allow access rule API only supports access-level,
which has "ro" and "rw" as valid values. This is not enough
when users want to specify priority to individual access rules.

This patch adds new priority attribute in allow/update access
rule API.

DocImpact

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574633/
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580582/

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I06960f5a59929dd233068ff262dd810194c5a85c
Implements: bp add-priority-for-access-rule

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-06 17:00:15.000000000', 'message': '"keepalived_state_change" needs to use threading to send arping

"keepalived_state_change" monitor does not use eventlet but normal
Python threads. When "send_ip_addr_adv_notif" is called from inside
the monitor, the arping command is never sent because the eventlet
thread does not start. In order to be able to be called from this
process, this method should also have an alternative implementation
using "threading".

"TestMonitorDaemon.test_new_fip_sends_garp" is also modified to
actually test the GARP sent. The test was originally implemented with
only one interface in the monitored namespace.
"keepalived_state_change" sends a GARP when a new IP address is added
in a interface other than the monitored one. That's why this patch
creates a new interface and sets it as the monitor interface. When
a new IP address is added to the other interface, the monitor populates
it by sending a GARP through the modified interface [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/8ee34655b8757086c03feecfda100333f47ed810/neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py#L90

Change-Id: Ib69e21b4645cef71db07595019fac9af77fefaa1
Closes-Bug: #1870313
(cherry picked from commit 21935365f29cce3fa95f032d9778786519461521)

commit_message:
"keepalived_state_change" needs to use threading to send arping

"keepalived_state_change" monitor does not use eventlet but normal
Python threads. When "send_ip_addr_adv_notif" is called from inside
the monitor, the arping command is never sent because the eventlet
thread does not start. In order to be able to be called from this
process, this method should also have an alternative implementation
using "threading".

"TestMonitorDaemon.test_new_fip_sends_garp" is also modified to
actually test the GARP sent. The test was originally implemented with
only one interface in the monitored namespace.
"keepalived_state_change" sends a GARP when a new IP address is added
in a interface other than the monitored one. That's why this patch
creates a new interface and sets it as the monitor interface. When
a new IP address is added to the other interface, the monitor populates
it by sending a GARP through the modified interface [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/8ee34655b8757086c03feecfda100333f47ed810/neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py#L90

Change-Id: Ib69e21b4645cef71db07595019fac9af77fefaa1
Closes-Bug: #1870313
(cherry picked from commit 21935365f29cce3fa95f032d9778786519461521)

subject: Support HTTP and TCP checks in UDP healthmonitor

commit_message:
Support HTTP and TCP checks in UDP healthmonitor

This patch introduces 2 macros in lvs.

1. Support HTTP GET, allow users create HTTP healthmonitor for udp pool.
2. Support TCP check, allow users create TCP healthmonitor for udp pool.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I61c7d8d4df54710a92b8c055be84bba29bf3d7e6
Story: 2003200
Task: 23356
Story: 2003199
Task: 23355

commit_message:
Create new release 15.5.0 for puppet-magnum in train

It includes some fixes needed for CentOS8 after last tag:

fe6fe19 Fix rabbitmq dependency
975b93d Add keystone_region_name to magnum::keystone::domain
68ac397 Fix client_package for RedHat > 7 and Fedora

Change-Id: I16a3564fd79702446f29f62baa21120d8aea00ac

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I105244ba94059a6149b8c72fd7b2eae4923531f7

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I97f5140020857694b5eda17e8f2c02b9b3066e0c
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove Babel from requirements, it's not needed for running.
- Update lower-constraints for osprofiler as required by
  other dependencies.

Change-Id: I84ec7cae5b051bb9c69969d8ccaa28b053914840

commit_message:
Refer keystone_authtoken instead of neutron to detect region

... because we generally use parameters under keystone_authtoken
to find credentials.

This patch also removes useless and incorrect handling about keystone
version, so that domain parameters are correctly set.

Change-Id: Ibfd489e977e8f8f52defecacc00cb8afcd1596a1

commit_message:
Correct description for encryption-type policies

The current 'path' (used only for documentation) is incorrect.  Not
a big deal except that using the encryption_id as described there
results in a 404, which is confusing to users.

Change-Id: I3c0afece33859552e85cd89626b349b43ebe038a
Closes-bug: #1873051

commit_message:
Add ability to write scripts

Add the ability to write out the command being exected to a script for
the roles that aren't single action list/show/remove/etc as they would
not be something to rerun and are really for ansible-only control.

Change-Id: I11ad3c12de21fe0522d13f966783cb413b661646

[{'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-02-20 10:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2020-02-20 13:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-02-20 14:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

I tested it and it works as expected, only the doc needs a little improvement.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2020-02-20 15:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30742, 'date': '2020-02-20 16:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-02-20 23:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 30760, 'date': '2020-02-22 20:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Uploaded patch set 5.

can we add some kind of documentation link into commit message for end-user better understanding'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-02-24 09:46:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

To provide a background context for other reviewers on why the change is important and will be very helpful. 

The stestr scheduler divides the tests in alphabetical order (if there are no timing data provided - they aren't in case of a first run, which is the case for all CI jobs mainly) which leads to the situation one worker ends up with the same amount of the tests as the other ones except that the time required to run them is much longer because the worker runs mostly scenario tests - that results in the following situation, see the link showing busyness of the workers in a TripleO job:
https://logserver.rdoproject.org/openstack-periodic-master/opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/master/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_2comp-featureset020-master/8b9fadf/logs/stackviz/#/testrepository.subunit/timeline

(the job ran tempest tests with concurrency 3, however, at the end only one worker was executing tests and two other were idle).

Therefore the review will help scheduling tests more efficiently (scenario tests would be divided among more workers) and that will lead in saving many hours of CI time every day.

stestr doc for more info about scheduling:
https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#test-scheduling"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2020-02-24 10:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add --worker-file option in tempest

This patch add the option --worker-file on tempest run command.
This will enable users to specify a worker file that will be used
by stestr to manually schedule how the tests will run.

Change-Id: I747f3abe179492da063fcaaf1123ffcf6362f966

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ibd39328c27b68190e2edbf1f52fcea52db3ae791
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-26 16:25:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix six package on opensuse for pip 10

openSUE Leap 15.0 and 15.1 both provide python3-six version 1.11.0.
Since version 1.12.0 was released, pip>=10 recognizes the version
difference and tries to uninstall the distro-provided version and fails.
This change adds another hack to remove the egg-info file for the six
library so that pip can manage it directly. We also have to wait to
install os-testr until after the fixup has happened since trying to
install it triggers the issue.

Change-Id: I4649abe06b5893a5251bfcdd4234abccde6ceda2
(cherry picked from commit 6eb2c5990d738612c4cec34daeb673092303a50a)

commit_message:
Fix six package on opensuse for pip 10

openSUE Leap 15.0 and 15.1 both provide python3-six version 1.11.0.
Since version 1.12.0 was released, pip>=10 recognizes the version
difference and tries to uninstall the distro-provided version and fails.
This change adds another hack to remove the egg-info file for the six
library so that pip can manage it directly. We also have to wait to
install os-testr until after the fixup has happened since trying to
install it triggers the issue.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/715175

Change-Id: I4649abe06b5893a5251bfcdd4234abccde6ceda2
(cherry picked from commit 6eb2c5990d738612c4cec34daeb673092303a50a)

commit_message:
compute: Add missing 2.73 response schema validation

Microversion v2.73 was introduced in Nova by I46edd595e7417c58410648
changing the request responses of ``GET servers/{server_id}``, ``GET
/servers/detail``, ``POST /servers/{server_id}/action``  where the
action is rebuild and ``PUT servers/{server_id}``.

Change-Id: I8c800f6e280ec6fdf204d344124d994a25d0af19

[{'created': '2020-04-16 15:11:21.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve deprecation of encryption policy target

Commit ebc9a12a19bff61bd6101def5cc997513d329bc2 in Stein deprecated
the "volume_extension:volume_type_encryption" policy target for later
removal.  Instead of removing the target, this patch removes the
deprecation notice and retains the target as a base policy that can
be used to set the four finer-grained policies in one place.  Also
removes the supporting code that was logging a warning about the
deprecated policy.

See Bug #1873110 for a more thorough discussion of why the
deprecation is being resolved in this way.

Change-Id: I24fe5cedea9384d8708d44efb2f70a9cabfab6ca
Closes-bug: #1873110
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve deprecation of encryption policy target

Commit ebc9a12a19bff61bd6101def5cc997513d329bc2 in Stein deprecated
the "volume_extension:volume_type_encryption" policy target for later
removal.  Instead of removing the target, this patch removes the
deprecation notice and retains the target as a base policy that can
be used to set the four finer-grained policies in one place.  Also
removes the supporting code that was logging a warning about the
deprecated policy.

See Bug #1873110 for a more thorough discussion of why the
deprecation is being resolved in this way.

Change-Id: I24fe5cedea9384d8708d44efb2f70a9cabfab6ca
Closes-bug: #1873110

Before dealing with the policy target deprecation from commit
ebc9a12a19bff61bd6101def5cc997513d329bc2, make sure we have tests

commit_message:
Add tests for volume type encryption type policies

Before dealing with the policy target deprecation from commit
ebc9a12a19bff61bd6101def5cc997513d329bc2, make sure we have tests
in place to detect any regression in the default policy
configuration.

Closes-bug: #1872985
Change-Id: I1b51e5e85aa2a928c28e29c54283b6316a56da2a

commit_message:
Fix outdated get_glance_crednetials in Puppet::Provider::Glance

This patch is a cherry pick of the change in master[2] to update
outdated provider implementation, and introduce the implementetion
consisntent with other modules like puppet-nova or puppet-neutron.

[1] 066f45758d974bb6343c0b92583c8185ef588823

Closes-Bug: #1872691
Change-Id: I1dfcb311c10c633788c24484c21277255b60e4e5

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I5ca0fb28f6a24207e2b87bce357fc41a010cd052
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.5 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/718068
Change-Id: I55b4938edae85aa8108be62c49f0ac7fc6682997

commit_message:
Configure better ciphers for rabbitmq

with the default configuration the ssl configuration is vulnerable to
SWEET32.

nmap -sV --script ssl-enum-ciphers -p 5671 <ip>

Change-Id: Ic7492863fa7eecadec07b5da76801fe2530dbec6

Add ApacheMaxMaxClients property to set apache::mod::prefork::maxclients
and change add ApacheMaxRequestWorkers to set apache::mod::prefork::maxrequestworkers

is confusing.

Change-Id: I4e0e1beb733ae1c41d74d488481230026611c6c0
Closes-bug: #1871643
'}, {'created': '2020-04-10 13:13:35.000000000', 'message': 'Rename ApacheMaxMaxClients property to ApacheMaxRequestWorkers

Remove ApacheMaxMaxClients property to set apache::mod::prefork::maxclients
and add ApacheMaxRequestWorkers to set apache::mod::prefork::maxrequestworkers
as the current setting ApacheMaxRequestWorkers sets maxclients and this
is confusing.  This was due to maxclients being renamed to maxrequestworkers
in the apache configuration so was legacy naming.

Change-Id: I4e0e1beb733ae1c41d74d488481230026611c6c0
Closes-bug: #1871643
'}]
commit_message:
Rename ApacheMaxMaxClients property to ApacheMaxRequestWorkers

Remove ApacheMaxMaxClients property to set apache::mod::prefork::maxclients
and add ApacheMaxRequestWorkers to set apache::mod::prefork::maxrequestworkers
as the current setting ApacheMaxRequestWorkers sets maxclients and this
is confusing.  This was due to maxclients being renamed to maxrequestworkers
in the apache configuration so was legacy naming.

Change-Id: I4e0e1beb733ae1c41d74d488481230026611c6c0
Closes-bug: #1871643

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version

Change-Id: Ic7696a6ba0fc213b59edf87cf9ef2a804ebca94f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 16:05:26.000000000', 'message': "Change gerrit ACLs for cinder-tempest-plugin

Currently the cinder-tempest-plugin repo uses the cinder ACLs.
Change it to use its own ACL config file governed by a specific
'cinder-tempest-plugin-core' gerrit group.  The cinder-core group
will be added to this as an included group.  This will give us the
option to add cores to cinder-tempest-plugin who aren't also in
cinder-core.

Change-Id: I2244b680eef93f9ff30ffd69c7da0e226a76d427
"}, {'created': '2020-04-15 16:09:31.000000000', 'message': "Change gerrit ACLs for cinder-tempest-plugin

Currently the cinder-tempest-plugin repo uses the cinder ACLs.
Change it to use its own ACL config file governed by a specific
'cinder-tempest-plugin-core' gerrit group.  The cinder-core group
will be added to this as an included group.  This will give us the
option to add cores to cinder-tempest-plugin who aren't also in
cinder-core.

Change-Id: I2244b680eef93f9ff30ffd69c7da0e226a76d427
"}]
commit_message:
Change gerrit ACLs for cinder-tempest-plugin

Currently the cinder-tempest-plugin repo uses the cinder ACLs.
Change it to use its own ACL config file governed by a specific
'cinder-tempest-plugin-core' gerrit group.  The cinder-core group
will be added to this as an included group.  This will give us the
option to add cores to cinder-tempest-plugin who aren't also in
cinder-core.

Change-Id: I2244b680eef93f9ff30ffd69c7da0e226a76d427

commit_message:
Add vitrage-persistor service

Kolla Ansible was missing vitrage-persistor service
required by Vitrage for data storage.

Depends on fixing availability of Kolla image.

Change-Id: I8158ba66b8b624f6bcb89da9c990a30a68b7187b
Depends-On: Id5e143636f9a81e7294b775f3d8b9134bee58054
Closes-Bug: #1869319

commit_message:
Fix that the cyborg database init failed.

The database init command should be 'cyborg-dbsync upgrade'.

Change-Id: I4541c3c070ca70a2ee62f2a0e4ac5d70c57ca6e9
Closes-bug: #1872432
(cherry picked from commit 43de719c3ac17085423b381e5938d1bf83e3ff65)

subject: Simplify tripleo_container_rm to not check binaries
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26343, 'name': 'Jose Luis Franco', 'email': 'jfrancoa@redhat.com', 'username': 'jfrancoa'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-16 22:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-16 22:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-04-17 09:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:08:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

If I remember correctly, all that code was added because the container_cli is just a hardcoded value, and we didn't have a good way to catch if the environment where we ran the role had docker enabled or not (when upgrading from Queens to Rocky, which is the point when we moved completely to Podman).

However, it should be save to remove this code (even for FFWD from Queens to Train, as we upgrade the OS and all remainings of Docker are removed during the operating system upgrade)"}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-04-17 13:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-16 22:16:38.000000000', 'message': "Simplify tripleo_container_rm to not check binaries

There is no need to check container cli binaries; since we have
tripleo_container_cli variable, we should expect that binary to be
installed.

At scale, when used with tripleo_container_manage, these stat tasks end
up being run too many times. Let's clean it.

Change-Id: If0d6d8a737a22b85ed38e6c64c11d9df81ef3a9b
"}, {'created': '2020-04-16 22:19:40.000000000', 'message': "Simplify tripleo_container_rm to not check binaries

There is no need to check container cli binaries; since we have
tripleo_container_cli variable, we should expect that binary to be
installed.

At scale, when used with tripleo_container_manage, these stat tasks end
up being run too many times. Let's clean it.

The code was done in the context of:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1836531

But there is no docker engine anymore, we use Podman since Stein;
so we shouldn't need it anymore.

Change-Id: If0d6d8a737a22b85ed38e6c64c11d9df81ef3a9b
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify tripleo_container_rm to not check binaries

There is no need to check container cli binaries; since we have
tripleo_container_cli variable, we should expect that binary to be
installed.

At scale, when used with tripleo_container_manage, these stat tasks end
up being run too many times. Let's clean it.

The code was done in the context of:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1836531

But there is no docker engine anymore, we use Podman since Stein;
so we shouldn't need it anymore.

Change-Id: If0d6d8a737a22b85ed38e6c64c11d9df81ef3a9b

commit_message:
Configure better ciphers for rabbitmq

with the default configuration the ssl configuration is vulnerable to
SWEET32.

nmap -sV --script ssl-enum-ciphers -p 5671 <ip>

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720744

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I2f8067eeb2aec62f098bfbb3770a67f1876ce7a2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-17 13:40:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove Babel from requirements

It's not a runtime dependency (and even oslo.i18n has dropped it).
The translation infrastructure installs Babel explicitly. See
this mailing list thread for a full reasoning:

Change-Id: I2898616ec6302bb578ddc265d6c6dc02d8415eac

commit_message:
Remove Babel from requirements

It's not a runtime dependency (and even oslo.i18n has dropped it).
The translation infrastructure installs Babel explicitly. See
this mailing list thread for a full reasoning:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I2898616ec6302bb578ddc265d6c6dc02d8415eac

subject: DBMS: Fix volume deletion with MySQL
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 9535, 'name': 'Gorka Eguileor', 'email': 'geguileo@redhat.com', 'username': 'Gorka'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27615, 'name': 'Rajat Dhasmana', 'email': 'rajatdhasmana@gmail.com', 'username': 'whoami-rajat'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-03-19 18:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-03-24 12:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-03 12:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-04-17 13:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

We had the same (or a similar) bug in Cinder.  We added a unit test to prevent it from happening again if the DB is modified, but that relies on sqlalchemy [0], not sure whether you could do something like that in cinderlib, or whether it would be overkill.  Would be good if we had a way to get info about this kind of fix from Cinder -> cinderlib.  We may have to simply rely on reviewers noticing and adding cinderlib to appropriate cinder bugs.  Might be a good idea for you to have a short session at the Victoria PTG about this to raise awareness of the kind of things Cinder reviewers should be looking for.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/branch/master/cinder/tests/unit/db/test_orm_relationships.py'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2020-04-17 13:41:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Is there a chance that other tables like[1] might produce the same condition?
I'm not much aware of the similarities between cinder and cinderlib but might be good idea to list all the foreign key dependent tables.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/branch/master/cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L1676-L1680"}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-04-17 13:47:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the reviews.
We don't use any of the other tables in cinderlib, but it is a good idea to add some comments on the dbms.py file to explain that we need to delete any rows that we create when saving a volume."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-19 18:59:08.000000000', 'message': "DBMS: Fix volume deletion with MySQL

When using the DBMS plugin with MySQL with default configuration (hard
DB row deletes) the deletion of a volume fails if the volume has
metadata or admin metadata.

The reason are the foreign key constraints from those 2 tables, because
we are not deleting their rows before deleting the volume row.

This doesn't fail with SQLite, but we leave rows behind.

With this patch we will delete all metadata and admin_metadata belonging
to the volume before we delete the volume row itself.

Closes-Bug: #1868148
Change-Id: I8712045752a7a150a3633451246ed992dee35972
"}, {'created': '2020-03-24 12:43:52.000000000', 'message': "DBMS: Fix volume deletion with MySQL

When using the DBMS plugin with MySQL with default configuration (hard
DB row deletes) the deletion of a volume fails if the volume has
metadata or admin metadata.

The reason are the foreign key constraints from those 2 tables, because
we are not deleting their rows before deleting the volume row.

This doesn't fail with SQLite, but we leave rows behind.

With this patch we will delete all metadata and admin_metadata belonging
to the volume before we delete the volume row itself.

Closes-Bug: #1868148
Change-Id: I8712045752a7a150a3633451246ed992dee35972
"}]
commit_message:
DBMS: Fix volume deletion with MySQL

When using the DBMS plugin with MySQL with default configuration (hard
DB row deletes) the deletion of a volume fails if the volume has
metadata or admin metadata.

The reason are the foreign key constraints from those 2 tables, because
we are not deleting their rows before deleting the volume row.

This doesn't fail with SQLite, but we leave rows behind.

With this patch we will delete all metadata and admin_metadata belonging
to the volume before we delete the volume row itself.

Closes-Bug: #1868148
Change-Id: I8712045752a7a150a3633451246ed992dee35972

commit_message:
Remove Babel from requirements

It's not used in runtime and is only needed (presumably) for building
i18n catalogs.

commit_message:
ChunkedBackupDriver: Freeing memory on restore

When restoring many backups, the backup service uses a lot of memory and
when we do many concurrent restores the backup service ends up getting
killed becase the system runs out of memory.

This patch reduces the ref count to the data as soon as possible to let
Python garbage collect it instead of hogging it for the whole chunk
restore.

Related-Bug: #1865011
Change-Id: I942d9d8b3976232ae1cf82b698fb27285fbef13a
(cherry picked from commit 69462315bc8416bd02ebd6085f0cfc141cfd8877)
(cherry picked from commit 94db15dd3b86c7da92ceaa4b8c2d948b2b30c65b)
(cherry picked from commit f4aa81424fff8718bd432cc5a7aae357fe028023)
(cherry picked from commit 20b6b7477daae43907f38337aef15a5f47a92283)

commit_message:
Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Iaceea4271459eeb0c5066b2a9304754691c16712

os_keystone_domain_info returns a dict which contains
openstack_domains but currently that dict was considered
as openstack_domains which is wrong, this patch fixes

Change-Id: Ic063facf1f5f87c0e3a01803937a620a9b77d4b5

commit_message:
Correctly set openstack_domains for ansible >= 2.9

os_keystone_domain_info returns a dict which contains
openstack_domains but currently that dict was considered
as openstack_domains which is wrong, this patch fixes
it.

Closes-Bug: #1867608
Change-Id: Ic063facf1f5f87c0e3a01803937a620a9b77d4b5
(cherry picked from commit e86977ab48e4d7e66bda9060e51e396d4f6a85fe)

commit_message:
Retire repo_build and pip_install roles

Because of role retirement we need to drop them out of
zuul required projects. However this shouldn't influence role usage
outside of the CI as they are still required for services deployment.

Change-Id: Iac3a8eefcf231f735ff617d5605c6e1fda85b164

commit_message:
FUP: doc: explaining that resize works for vGPUs

We have a documentation for virtual GPUs, just modifying it to tell
that now resize and revert resize work with them.

Change-Id: I5b8b670761057e94911761872fe15250a97447fe

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ifa951b54daf715684a25ba5e1d6dedb230492236
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Break out py27 job templates

To allow non-py27 supporting repos to use shade job templates, this
breaks out the py27 and py3 jobs into separate templates. Relevant repos
can then continue to use the existing template names without picking up
the unsupported job runtimes they no longer need.

Remove the py27-tips jobs - they just don't make any sense any more.

Change-Id: Ia211e31723ede592f19a8df6c18e45699ca25788
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
podman_container: only add --rm if rm is True

If "rm" is set to False (default), don't add --rm=False to the podman
command, it seems like podman treats it as --rm anyway. Let's just skip
that parameter if set to False and add it if True.

Change-Id: Ic2877684cd0210b23b23d852ee59fa49d9013f0d
(cherry picked from commit 06bc6505de8dd21ec789e4f69a5563c5ce132d28)

commit_message:
podman_container: only add --rm if rm is True

If "rm" is set to False (default), don't add --rm=False to the podman
command, it seems like podman treats it as --rm anyway. Let's just skip
that parameter if set to False and add it if True.

Change-Id: Ic2877684cd0210b23b23d852ee59fa49d9013f0d

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg:
  * Wheel is not needed for python 3 only repo

Change-Id: Ie5bf4b5226a06d828ec24a6134d7ea8a3f45c8db

Pass wait timeout all the way through to clients

Pass the non-interactive wait timeout value through.

Change-Id: I25c2e982ebabe09385e52fef0fb8c97cabe60756
Closes-Bug: #1841063

commit_message:
RBD: Add missing driver options

The RBD driver was missing some of its configuration options in the
`get_driver_options` method returned list.

This patch adds those missing configuration options.

Change-Id: Ifdd2d54ba22d4fdc68be7d39f6f13cd543755df2

subject: add collectd-pmu, collectd-rtd and collectd-turbostat to C8
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'email': 'radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com', 'username': 'yoctozepto'}, {'_account_id': 31539, 'name': 'Piotr Rabiega', 'email': 'piotrx.rabiega@intel.com', 'username': 'prabiegx'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-09 11:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-09 11:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi,
thank you for doing this. I just realized, the turbostat plugin is missing in the list as well, but it is also available on c8.'}, {'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-09 12:16:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Maybe I should also add pmu here? final version would be:

  {% if base_arch =='x86_64' %}
    {% set collectd_packages = collectd_packages + [
      'collectd-hugepages',
      'collectd-pmu'
      'collectd-rdt',
      'collectd-turbostat'
    ] %}
  {% endif %}

As far as I remember we should have everything on C7 and C8."}, {'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-09 12:17:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Missed coma for pmu, correction:

  {% if base_arch =='x86_64' %}
    {% set collectd_packages = collectd_packages + [
      'collectd-hugepages',
      'collectd-pmu',
      'collectd-rdt',
      'collectd-turbostat'
    ] %}
  {% endif %}"}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-09 12:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yes, that looks good and much simpler'}, {'account_id': 31539, 'date': '2020-04-09 12:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-09 14:44:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

fails due to 

INFO:kolla.common.utils.collectd: Problem: conflicting requests

INFO:kolla.common.utils.collectd:  - nothing provides libpqos.so.3()(64bit) needed by collectd-rdt-5.10.0-3.el8.x86_64

As you see in https://cbs.centos.org/koji/rpminfo?rpmID=188527
and http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8/opstools/x86_64/collectd-5/Packages/i/
intel-cmt-cat is on the mirrors.

I'll tag the package"}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-09 14:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

okay, figured this out, it still pulls from the other opstools repo, the added collectd package is 5.10 instead of 5.11 from centos-opstools.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-16 14:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-17 10:23:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

we can ignore the rhel8-train failure here. This looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-17 11:03:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> we can ignore the rhel8-train failure here. This looks good to me

If this job is permanently broken, can we remove it? I'd rather not keep a failing job around."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-17 11:04:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-04-17 11:58:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes! I'd want that broken job to be removed asap. I still did not found the location, where it is defined. I'd want to replace it with a working job."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-04-17 12:06:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Yes! I'd want that broken job to be removed asap. I still did not
 > found the location, where it is defined. I'd want to replace it
 > with a working job.

Here, I think: https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/ca39b629830479ab7cf40d8335dc1b26e34d6d69/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L156"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-04-17 13:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2019-08-27 18:16:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I877f06eb495703615b27e31f66c6e9645604738f
'}]
commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I877f06eb495703615b27e31f66c6e9645604738f

[{'created': '2020-04-17 13:44:33.000000000', 'message': "Remove Babel from requirements

It's not a runtime dependency (and even oslo.i18n has dropped it).
The translation infrastructure installs Babel explicitly. See
this mailing list thread for a full reasoning:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I0decb5537c8d3c920547f4a086b600f7b8782eec

commit_message:
Remove Babel from requirements

It's not a runtime dependency (and even oslo.i18n has dropped it).
The translation infrastructure installs Babel explicitly. See
this mailing list thread for a full reasoning:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I0decb5537c8d3c920547f4a086b600f7b8782eec

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-16 14:21:43.000000000', 'message': "Silence the YAML NoneType warning for password_security-compliance

If the value is not set (the default) then the context causes a error
message to be emitted to the Juju log.  Whilst this doesn't affect the
operations of the charm, it is likely to cause support requests.  This
change only attempts to decode the config option if it is actually set.

Change-Id: I0ccccdab92cb46f7354732f9d620797910ba55c0
"}]
commit_message:
Silence the YAML NoneType warning for password_security-compliance

If the value is not set (the default) then the context causes a error
message to be emitted to the Juju log.  Whilst this doesn't affect the
operations of the charm, it is likely to cause support requests.  This
change only attempts to decode the config option if it is actually set.

Change-Id: I0ccccdab92cb46f7354732f9d620797910ba55c0

commit_message:
Add support for resource provider bandwidth in Neutron config

Neutron introduced bandwidth aware scheduling some time ago. In [1]
new config options to set up available bandwidth in ovs agent was
introduced.
In [2] similar config options for SR-IOV agent was also added.

This patch adds support for both of them in neutron puppet module.

Related Tripleo-heat-templates patch is [3]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/577223/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/581364/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714464/

Change-Id: Iba2b73adcf68407994a0651351babcb6cd9ddff3

commit_message:
Ignoring host recovery if host_status is `UNKNOWN`

This patch adds validation to ignore host recovery if received
host_status as `UNKNOWN` in notification payload.

Change-Id: Ie32f6c0933e15edc78a86687742a4e87e3623a85
Closes-Bug: #1858762

commit_message:
Improve test coverage

Added a number of unit tests based on coverage report
data, it's up to 79% now.

Fixed test_pool_create_exception() to call pool_create()
instead of pool_update().

Also fixed a bug in the driver.pool_update() exception code
path found when adding a new test, status['pools'] is the
correct element.

Change-Id: Ic72aad21e0ecf5b0334b321b18515d909daa3ba4

commit_message:
Fix helm tests for Ceph 14.2.8

Since Ceph 14.2.8 output of 'ceph osd stat' in json-pretty
format changed. OSD stats were put in osdmap field. This
commit fixes helm tests according changes in Ceph.

Change-Id: I6579d2868c6ea6d74feb62e65cdb15e3f647fe72

commit_message:
Change the order of resource creation

Resource creation order in kubernetes templates for Fedora Atomic
was changed to avoid neutron bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1845360
Floating IP should be assigned to network port after instance creation

Change-Id: Ib7e0503d475d7cd3164a116c3a0325c4ae417a0a
Story: 2006631
Task: 36844

commit_message:
Add new classes to define keystone credentials for inspector

This patch introduces the following new classes, to define keystone
credentials used in ironic-inspector.

 - ironic::inspector::ironic
 - ironic::inspector::service_catalog
 - ironic::inspector::swift

Change-Id: I49adcbb6d90b2ef051cd862362fa1a7144fd9093

[{'created': '2020-04-09 12:48:46.000000000', 'message': "Don't reschedule hosts unless we need to

Only reschedule gateways/update segments when things have changed
that would require those actions.

This code has been cherry-picked from neutron:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705660

Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>

      networking_ovn/common/utils.py
      networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
      networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py
      networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py

commit_message:
Don't reschedule hosts unless we need to

Only reschedule gateways/update segments when things have changed
that would require those actions.

This code has been cherry-picked from neutron:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705660

Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>

Conflicts:
      networking_ovn/common/utils.py
      networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
      networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py
      networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py

Change-Id: I62f53dbd862c0f38af4a1434d453e97c18777eb4
Closes-bug: #1861510
Closes-bug: #1861509

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 11:41:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix ui package name and service scheduling

This small patch fixes 2 bugs, and add one feature. Bug fixes are:
1/ Fixes the cloudkitty-dashboard package name for Debian & Ubuntu
2/ Service['aodh-api'] -> Service[$service_name] scheduling, so that
Apache starts *after* cloudkitty-api is stopped, and so there's no
Apache cannot bind on port problem.

Feature:
Allow Debian & Ubuntu to run with the cloudkitty-api service instead of
Apache. Indeed, Debian supports  using uwsgi for the API by default.

Change-Id: I9e141b70d52d64b72555de7a15043303f57b5cc0
"}, {'created': '2018-12-13 11:50:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix ui package name and service scheduling

commit_message:
Don't reschedule hosts unless we need to

Only reschedule gateways/update segments when things have changed
that would require those actions.

This code has been cherry-picked from neutron:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705660

Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>

      networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py

commit_message:
Add periodic-weekly pipeline

Adds a periodic pipeline which runs weekly in addition to the current
one that runs daily, which is too often for some jobs.

Change-Id: Ib1bd96a3ace6920479137f99cb0c581dccb13e3c

[{'created': '2020-03-25 12:04:35.000000000', 'message': 'Support application certs

The idea of an application cert is that it is identical on all
units. To generate one the interface collects all the published
sans and cns from the clients and generates one certificate
which is valid for all of them.

This change relies on an interface change *1

Change-Id: I24362d23e2445970a7d1b078380f22dc672487ee
'}]
commit_message:
Support application certs

The idea of an application cert is that it is identical on all
units. To generate one the interface collects all the published
sans and cns from the clients and generates one certificate
which is valid for all of them.

This change relies on an interface change *1

*1 https://github.com/juju-solutions/interface-tls-certificates/pull/22

Change-Id: I24362d23e2445970a7d1b078380f22dc672487ee

Apparently, this fix is insufficient.

Perhaps we need to rework the whole driver validation interface to make it usable for specific booting use-cases.

We boot the agent for deploy,  cleaning, rescue and inspection. In each case the required options for booting ramdisk can differ.

We already have `validate_inspection` as workaround. May be we should have some sort of generic `validate_ramdisk` with more specific validations on top of it...'}]

commit_message:
Do boot validation on cleaning

Added missing boot interface validation as part of agent
preparation for cleaning. Depending on the hardware type being
used for agent invocation, boot interface might need to be
validated to catch possible agent booting issues.

Change-Id: I633761714231f462964c6ca4138ca74bada68d1f

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove hacking from requirements, it's required in tox.ini already

Change-Id: Ie5d87c62cca191c345bc273e9e43415ec4501df7

commit_message:
Don't reschedule hosts unless we need to

Only reschedule gateways/update segments when things have changed
that would require those actions.

This code has been cherry-picked from neutron:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705660

Co-Authored-By: Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>

Conflicts:
      networking_ovn/common/utils.py
      networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
      networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py
      networking_ovn/tests/unit/ovsdb/test_ovsdb_monitor.py

Change-Id: I62f53dbd862c0f38af4a1434d453e97c18777eb4
Closes-bug: #1861510
Closes-bug: #1861509

We don't care about pypy anymore, this is one of the last few uses in
all of OpenDev. Remove it.

Feilong,
This service is required only for nfs v2/v3 mounts. It is required for train, if users want to mount nfs volumes. Let's cherry-pick.
For info, this [0] works, this doesn't [1]. Here is the code for this utility.
rpm: https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/nfs-utils/blob/master/f/nfs-utils.spec
release tarballs: https://mirrors.edge.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/nfs-utils/
git: http://git.linux-nfs.org/?p=steved/nfs-utils.git;a=blob;f=systemd/rpc-statd.service;h=095629f295266512bd6bbac9ee4c6d7c26967f05;hb=HEAD

[0]
 ---
 apiVersion: v1
 kind: PersistentVolume
 metadata:
   name: nfs
 spec:
   capacity:
     storage: 1Mi
   accessModes:
     - ReadWriteMany
   nfs:
     server: str-cc7-nfs-02.cern.ch
     path: "/var/nfs"
 ---
 apiVersion: v1
 kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
 metadata:
   name: nfs
 spec:
   accessModes:
     - ReadWriteMany
   storageClassName: ""
   resources:
     requests:
       storage: 1Mi

[1]
 <     - ReadWriteMany
 ---
 >     - ReadOnlyMany
 >   mountOptions:
 >   - nfsvers=3
 12,13c14,15
 <     server: str-cc7-nfs-02.cern.ch
 <     path: "/var/nfs"
 ---
 >     path: /var/nfs
 >     server: str-cc7-nfs-03.cern.ch
 21c23
 <     - ReadWriteMany
 ---
 >     - ReadOnlyMany'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-04-17 08:20:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for the details, Spyros. That's the info I was looking for. Happy to approve this now."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-17 08:52:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 752250e89e35c970e884c2c7651ebe645cd17594'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-17 12:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This issue would have been caught with:

There is a sonobuoy test for it apparently, but not included in conformance.

I'm creating a story include the sonobuoy tests we want.'}]

commit_message:
fcos-kubelet: Add rpc-statd dependency

To mount nfs volumes with the embedded volume
pkg [0], rpc-statd is required and should be
started by mount.nfs. When running kubelet
in a chroot this fails. With atomic containers
it used to work.

[0] https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/pkg/volume/nfs

story: 2005201
task: 39403

Change-Id: Ib64efe7ecbe9a24e86fa9d9a35a4d90c0e8bbf2e
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

subject: Remove nodeSelector for flannel DaemonSet
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-17 10:19:05.000000000', 'message': "Remove nodeSelector for flannel DaemonSet

According to upstream kube-flannel.yml PR[1], node-selector introduced
is because flannel image doesn't support multiarch manifestes. Which
means that it can't specify flannel:version-arch images in the same
daemonset for every arch platform. To make every arch platform can
deploy flannel upstream add one daemonset with nodeSelector per arch.

But in magnum flannel image tag is configurable via label, thus every
arch platform can use one daemonset to deploy by specify corresponding
flannel image tag. So nodeSelector is unnecessary here.

[1]: https://github.com/coreos/flannel/pull/989

Change-Id: I97e78e8d77973e03eeff598b212287945ca00190
Task: 39453
Story: 2007026
(cherry picked from commit 6a3762173279dd7fd85d767eb7d6e07b4760270c)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove nodeSelector for flannel DaemonSet

According to upstream kube-flannel.yml PR[1], node-selector introduced
is because flannel image doesn't support multiarch manifestes. Which
means that it can't specify flannel:version-arch images in the same
daemonset for every arch platform. To make every arch platform can
deploy flannel upstream add one daemonset with nodeSelector per arch.

But in magnum flannel image tag is configurable via label, thus every
arch platform can use one daemonset to deploy by specify corresponding
flannel image tag. So nodeSelector is unnecessary here.

[1]: https://github.com/coreos/flannel/pull/989

Change-Id: I97e78e8d77973e03eeff598b212287945ca00190
Task: 39453
Story: 2007026
(cherry picked from commit 6a3762173279dd7fd85d767eb7d6e07b4760270c)

[{'created': '2020-04-09 19:37:34.000000000', 'message': "[Fullstack] Handle properly BrokenPipeError exception

NetcatTester class should handle BrokenPipeError exception
and not raise it to fail test immediately if nc process wasn't
yet started when it tries first time to read/write something to
it.

Change-Id: Ica953cc2038b24c4b3985447b393763912aa6abd

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Handle properly BrokenPipeError exception

NetcatTester class should handle BrokenPipeError exception
and not raise it to fail test immediately if nc process wasn't
yet started when it tries first time to read/write something to
it.

Change-Id: Ica953cc2038b24c4b3985447b393763912aa6abd
Closes-Bug: #1871908

commit_message:
Add variable to set discovery timeout in tempest tests

Discovery can take longer based on which image we use for testing.
This patch adds a variable to control the discovery timeout.

Change-Id: I5654d4bf5131ab4c900f9dfd77358c5f8100b38a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-15 18:02:59.000000000', 'message': "Use healthcheck_port for ironic_inspector_dnsmasq healthcheck

ironic_inspector_dnsmasq healthchecks currently use healthcheck_listen()
to check if dnsmasq is listening for udp packets on the DHCP port. In
Train we are seeing occasional failures with this healthcheck. It may be
the same issue as in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1860556,
which was resolved for healthcheck_port but not for healthcheck_listen.

It appears that this has been redone in master to get away from 'ss' -
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708339/. However, in master healthcheck_listen
only works with tcp ports, so the ironic_inspector_dnsmasq healthcheck
fails in master too.

A better way is to use healthcheck_port for ironic_inspector_dnsmasq
healthchecks. Since this is a udp port, this will work with Train and master

Change-Id: I16e6d462b0eca60e75eb5b91259575e62f17fe31
Closes-Bug: 1873049
"}]
commit_message:
Use healthcheck_port for ironic_inspector_dnsmasq healthcheck

ironic_inspector_dnsmasq healthchecks currently use healthcheck_listen()
to check if dnsmasq is listening for udp packets on the DHCP port. In
Train we are seeing occasional failures with this healthcheck. It may be
the same issue as in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1860556,
which was resolved for healthcheck_port but not for healthcheck_listen.

It appears that this has been redone in master to get away from 'ss' -
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708339/. However, in master healthcheck_listen
only works with tcp ports, so the ironic_inspector_dnsmasq healthcheck
fails in master too.

A better way is to use healthcheck_port for ironic_inspector_dnsmasq
healthchecks. Since this is a udp port, this will work with Train and master

Change-Id: I16e6d462b0eca60e75eb5b91259575e62f17fe31
Closes-Bug: 1873049

nova-libvirt: fix after centos 7 removal damage

Removal of CentOS 7 butchered Dockerfile.j2 so UEFI was not installed in
Debian/Ubuntu images.

commit_message:
CentOS 8: seed VM & bifrost

* Install iptables on seed for SNAT - missing on CentOS 8
* Fix provider network MTU lookup for empty string
* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-host to 1.7.0 for CentOS 8 support
* Bump stackhpc.libvirt-vm to 1.13.0 for CentOS 8 support
* Bump jriguera.configdrive for Python 3 support

The following changes from the master version of this patch are not
applied here. These should be applied through configuration:

* Change default seed VM image to CentOS 8
* Change default bifrost deploy image to CentOS 8
* Workaround DIB bug
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1866847 by setting
  DIB_DISABLE_KERNEL_CLEANUP to 1

Change-Id: Ie0edf6a924a914395c6502e2d5cf1139bce14a48
Story: 2006574
Task: 39000
(cherry picked from commit 51b84b6001e90435aa76aa09a763edf8063ed085)

commit_message:
Support iproute2 4.15 in l3_tc_lib

In version 4.15 of iproute2 there was added support
for chain index in tc_filter [1].
Such version is available e.g. in Ubuntu 18.04 and it
has to be supported in l3_tc_lib regex to match
properly output of "tc filter" command.

[1] https://lwn.net/Articles/745643/

Closes-bug: #1809497
Change-Id: Id4066b5cff933ccd0dd3c751bf67b5d58af662d1
(cherry picked from commit e788d294584add2407f601a46f90b08082cccc5f)

(2 comments)

How do I test this?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-16 22:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-16 23:08:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Bharat, thanks for viewing this feature. The testing is super easy. You just need to test if the cluster's health_status and health_status_reason can be updated with command:

openstack coe cluster update <id> replace health_status=UNKNOWN

openstack oce cluster update <id> replace health_status_reason=worker_1.Ready=False

NOTE: As for the health_status_reason testing, you may need this client patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/713344/"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-18 02:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-18 08:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-18 19:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-19 07:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-19 08:00:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

:) thanks i'll test this today"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-22 21:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-24 09:13:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Just tested this with this cluster template/cluster configuration: https://seashells.io/p/NMEsQRQN. The cluster is reporting its status as UNHEALTHY and nothing happens when I try to update the cluster health_status and health_status_reason, i.e. it doesn't get updated."}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-24 09:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Ok in the earlier test, I realised that it was resolving to UNHEALTHY due to an edge case addressed in this patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714589.

I tested with floating_ip_disabled and while this patch works, it is annoying that any update made is overridden by the poller back to UNKNOWN status within the polling interval.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-24 09:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

It would be much better if we did not need to update the health_status but it was automatically inferred from the health_status_reason at the point when it is received with the logic encapsulated within "_poll_health_status".'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-24 10:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

We could separate the logic inside _poll_health_status that evaluates the health_status_reason to a different function called "evaluate_health_status" to calculate the health status. It seems reduntant to me that we are updating both health_status and health_status_reason. It should be enough to just update health_status_reason.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-24 19:49:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@Bharat, thanks for testing and reviewing this patch. I understand that the internal health status updates periodic job is annoying when doing the test, so I'm going to introduce a new config to allow disabling the internal update.

As for calculating the health status based on health status reasons, it may not work, because the reasons format is a dict and could be flexible/changeable, which will make the calculating quite mess. So personally, I still prefer to allow updating both."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-24 19:58:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@Bharat, I just think about this again. We don't need to introduce any new config if your patch can fix the corner case. I will review your patch today. Thank you again."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-26 22:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-27 00:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

do you mind also rebasing on top of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714589/ in the next PS?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2020-03-27 01:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
[k8s] Support updating k8s cluster health status

The original design of k8s cluster health status is allowing
the health status being updated by Magnum control plane. However,
it doesn't work when the cluster is private. This patch supports
updating the k8s cluster health status via the Magnum cluster
update API by a 3rd party service so that a controller (e.g.
magnum-auto-healer) running inside the k8s cluster can call
the Magnum update API to update the cluster health status.

Task: 38583
Story: 2007242

Change-Id: Ie7189d328c4038403576b0324e7b0e8a9b305a5e

commit_message:
Add ironic::neutron::dhcpv6_stateful_address_count

Support fo additional ip address allocations when using
dhcpv6 stateful was added in https://review.opendev.org/700002
and backported to stein in https://review.opendev.org/717205.

This change adds support in the puppet module to configuring
the amount of addresses to allocate.

Conflicts:
    manifests/neutron.pp
    spec/classes/ironic_neutron_spec.rb

Related-Bug: #1861032
Closes-Bug: 1872992
Change-Id: I09e6ce611b12e92a4a8db64c7f23a491998e956b
(cherry picked from commit 596abc9587f18b222918a8e413c97fcc1f3affeb)

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Cleanup doc/source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Use newer openstackdocstheme version
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- Update hacking to version 3

Change-Id: I7e9e3993aeb05fb623be531160e418572fa9de54
